Reviews.Title: “Very tasteful”
Reviews.Author: Johncharlesandrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and was our first stay. We did not eat at the hotel. The initial valet welcome was quick. The check in was quick. The staff were always on hand to provide maps and tourist information. Free wine was served in the foyer at 5.30pm. A nice touch. The decor of silver, marble and mirrors was lovely. The rooms had all the usual facilities including a very smart coffee maker. We are in the fourth week of a road tour and have stayed at Westin, Vegas Hilton, Hyatt, Comfort, and a couple of other smaller chains, but feel that the Galleria Park just edged them all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: moconnor72
Reviews.Content: Just home from a wonderful three night stay in the Galleria! Greeted by a warm and friendly receptionist whose name escapes me (still jet lagged!) who delivered a fast and friendly check in. Our room whilst small was really lovely, well decorated and exceptionally clean! Highlight of our stay....Jacob, who was so wonderful to us - nothing was too much trouble for him - even drawing maps for us!! We really appreciated his help with the Alcatraz tickets too! Overall I could not recommend this hotel highly enough, as someone who has the opportunity to travel regularly I have to say the Galleria goes straight to the top of my favourite hotels! Thank you so much for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Galleria Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: somebodyhere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Galleria Park with my mom for a 4 night girls trip stay. Joel W. provided excellent service the entire time we were there. The service we received was definitely 5 starThe hotel is clean an well maintained. Though boutique hotels are often a little smaller and older, don't let that deter you. The Galleria Park is tastefully decorated with warm colors which gives it a comfortable and inviting feel. The bathroom is small but the fixtures are updated and well maintained. Most of all, our bathroom was clean and stayed clean thanks to the maid service all weekend. The beds were comfortable. Though I don't drink wine, they do have a wine reception every night which is well attended and a nice touch. I especially loved the garden area with the walking/running path. It was a nice oasis in the middle of a large city. Though the exercise room is small, the hotel is close enough to take a nice morning run along the wharf. I was super happy with the location. It was near public transportation so it was easy to get to Fisherman's wharf. It is literally blocks away from China Town and Union Square so it was so easy to walk or take the train everywhere. Joel patiently made sure I understood where to go to use public transportation and even called the tour company I had booked my tour with to make sure he gave me the right directions. If I come back to San Francisco, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Rich W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a two day weekend in between business trips. Found the hotel on Tripadvisor.com and the reviews gave me the confidence to book. The reviews were correct. Very nice hotel in a central location. Close to Union Square to catch the tour busses. I will stay here again the next time I’m in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel that is perfectly located in the heart of San Fran”
Reviews.Author: snadypooh
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I've stayed here. It's a gorgeous boutique hotel that has absolutely top notch service. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are even smaller but the service and location make this the perfect hotel. As with anywhere in downtown San Fran, parking is always an issue. There is a public lot that always has ample parking space half a block away. The daily maximum is $32 but if you leave by 8:00 am, you can get the early bird special rate. Union square shopping, Chinatown, and the Ferry Building marketplace are all within a 15 or so minute walk away. For the girls, there is zero counter space and very poor lighting for toiletries and make up. There is also complimentary coffee in the morning (house blend is tasty) and free wine tasting in the evening. Each room has an umbrella for you to use for all those rainy days. Walgreens and 7-11 are right around the corner too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy206
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Galleria Park. I loved this hotel! I am sensitive to fragrances and this hotel uses only fragrance-free environmentally friendly cleaning and laundry products. Staff was very helpful and the location, only a couple blocks off Union Square, could not have been better. We learned the history of the 3rd floor level terrace and walking track from Rick Evan's excellent architectural tour that meets up in the lobby of the Galleria Park. This hotel would normally be out of our price range, but they were running a promotion that made if affordable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay...would gladly do it all over again. Hotel met all of our needs!”
Reviews.Author: WhereIsMyMnd
Reviews.Content: We just wrapped up a week long stay at the Galleria Hotel and couldn't have been more pleased with our choice. The hotel is done in a stylish Art Deco design and is incredibly cozy. Â Lodgings are clean and are very relaxing to come back to after a long day of walking the hilly streets of San Francisco. Â The location is walking distance to some of the best shopping in town (Union Square), easily accessible to both BART and MUNI stops (1 block away and right outside the hotel door), and also has great options for last minute (7/11) or early morning (Starbucks, Coffee & Cocoa) stops. Â I was initially a bit nervous to book a single hotel for an entire week since we have a tendency to be nomads--what if the hotel didn't turn out to be what we were expecting? Â Thankfully, we really enjoyed our stay and looked forward to returning to the same place each night. Â The room (a king guest room) was somewhat small lengthwise, but featured a very high ceiling that abated any feelings of claustrophobia. Â The bed was comfortable with smooth linens (admittedly the pillows were a bit mushy for my liking, but the room came with five, which helped make them a bit more substantial). Â Technology wise, the hotel offers free Wi-Fi, a large flat screen television, and a multi-plug station on its writing desk. Â The room also came with standard amenities such as a hairdryer, iron, and mini-fridge. Â My only qualm with the mini-fridge is that it was so incredibly stocked with mini-bar items that we could only fit in two of our outside drinks at a time, but that's very small in the scheme of things. Note: not all rooms have tubs. If you plan on doing sightseeing, I would request a room with a tub so that you can soak your feet after you return... We requested a quiet room since we're not accustomed to the 24/7 traffic of a larger city. Â We did not hear any other guests during the entirety of our stay aside from the occasional opening and shutting of room doors. Â Our room had a single window facing out into an inner courtyard that really wasn't too much to look at, but our main concern was that we be able to sleep after a long day sightseeing. Â The hotel was incredibly quiet at night despite the fact that so many people were staying there. Â  We would definitely stay here again. Â I feel as though we got a great value for our money and that the people who work here couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine T
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference at another hotel up the street, but I wanted a hotel that had free wifi and was a little less expensive. The Galleria Park Hotel was just the ticket. I spent 5 nights here. The staff was great, the rooms although a little small, were nicely appointed and very comfortable and very clean. I loved the free wine reception in the evening and I also took advantage of the outdoor walking path and the excercise room. The equipment in the excercise room was all in working condition. The GPH was a quick walk to Chinatown, Union Square and the Bart. Very nice location. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique style hotel in a convenient location. . .”
Reviews.Author: MMas9
Reviews.Content: Overall, I had a great stay here. The front desk was exceptionally polite, and very helpful in arranging for a taxi and guidance on restaurants. This neighborhood is probably considered downtown/financial district, but it's just across the street from Chinatown too. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance, but the immediate neighborhood does get quiet pretty early in the night. This is largely an area that people commute into for work, and then go back home elsewhere. I walked to North Beach a couple of times, and the walk was easy and interesting. You're also not very far from a handful of bus stops, so getting around shouldn't be a problem. As for the hotel, it was very clean (a must for me), quaint, well decorated, just trendy enough, and the rooms were done well. They're not extraordinarily large, but you have to expect that in NYC, San Francisco, Europe, etc. . . Having said that, I had plenty of space. Overall, great stay. My purpose was business and it was perfect for me. It could probably be in a more "lively" area for vacation, but you are not far from lively areas at all. I would recommend this to friends/family for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: melcort10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights while on a business trip. This is a phenomenal hotel and the rate I paid was below many of the surrounding properties. It is in a fantastic location right near the financial district but also close to Union Square and all lines of public transportation. I also walked to North Beach in around 15 minutes. The employees were all extremely helpful and the decor was adorable. You cannot miss the wine reception! As other posters have noted, there can be some street noise in the wee hours, but it did not disrupt my sleep. Also, some of the restaurants in the very near vicinity were not open on weekends. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “great choice.”
Reviews.Author: ahah654
Reviews.Content: visited san francisco for our 2year wedding aniversary. did lots of research on hotels and locations since we have neever been in the city. almost booked with another hotel but last minute reviews changed my mind and i dont regret it at all. great location just two blocks from bart subway station was very easy to walk with luggage to hotel and back to station. 3 blocks from powell st and cable cab. public transportation passes right in front of hotel door. we didn't ride a cab the whole 5 days (early 30's couple no kids) but even if we had kids we saw lots of tourist ridding on public buses. upon arival they had an available room for us and checked in at 1030am this was awesome. receptionist and evry member of the staff was extremely friendly and provided all kind of tips and suggestions. small touches made our stay even more enjoyable ( wine hour, umbrellas, coffe, nice bath ammenities room decor,and cleaness) yes rooms are a bit small but for a kingsize bedroom it was plenty for us. It is an Old Building which gives a lot of character to the whole experience, and rooms facing the street might be a little nooisy for some people, it wasn't for us and sleep like a baby, but you might want to consider an inside room if you have problem with street noise. next time we are in town will definitely stay here

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: mcmmwm
Reviews.Content: Myself and three other family members just spent 3 wonderful nights at the Galleria Park Hotel. I cannot recommend this hotel enough! It was the perfect size, in the perfect location with the most amazing staff! It didn't matter what time of day it was the staff member or members on duty were always ready to help. Yes, the rooms are a bit on the smaller side but then again you are in the city. However they were beautifully decorated (loved the art) and spotlessly clean. The property is well maintained as well. We will definitely be staying here again and recommending this beautiful property to everyone. Thanks for making our stay so special!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: karendor
Reviews.Content: We went to Galleria for our 15th anniversary celebration, with a special package through Zozi.com. After a smooth early check-in we walked to SOMA for a light lunch, then two blocks up for a bit of Union Square shopping, and came back to our Galleria Park room to enjoy the complementary wine & chocolates. As such, we skipped the happy hour wine tasting in lobby, but it looked very fun and lively as we headed out to dinner. Quick walk to fun places like Credo (Pine Street) and Rickhouse (fun bar on Kearny). I used the walking track which was lovely. Agree with other posters that rooms are small, but nicely furnished. Radiator heating is a little funky but it worked. One of tne of the nicest aspects of Galleria Park is that amazing big deco metallic fireplace in the lobby. We enjoyed the warm crackling fire on a drizzly Sunday in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: c w
Reviews.Content: having lived in the bay area for 10 years i was picky about where to stay and the quality of the hotel. hit a home run with the galleria. lovely lovely and the little special touches are great-umbrellas for walking around, wine reception every night, good coffee in the rooms and available every am on the mezz. parking is about $40 a night which seems horrible but actually isnt bad for sfo. beds are comfy, wifi is free and fast, hotel is clean, well appointed and quaint. great location. friendly helpful staff. except for usual city noise this hotel is surprisingly quiet and walls are well insulated, a benefit of these old buildings. the decor is sort of french deco, very cool. extremely happy with our choice, would stay here again and feel at home coming back to the room. just a couple of warnings-bathrooms are very small, the cable channels arent great but there is hbo, and while there is room service the menu is odd. we didnt order anything. i wouldnt let these things deter your stay but this is why i didnt give it five stars. what a wonderful three days! room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: tmotes1
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel at 1130 and were able to check right in. Concierge was friendly and personable. Let us know about the wine hour and the other amenities the hotel offered-morning coffee on the mezzanine, third floor walking track, work out room, etc. Got us set up with a city map and we were set. Rooms on the small side, but stylishly decorated and clean. Walking distance to Chinatown, Union Square Park, Powell Street shopping and a slightly longer, but still manageable walk to Embarcadero and Fisherman's Wharf. Luggage stowage on checkout. Great property, centrally located and exceptional service. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for business”
Reviews.Author: Lancburm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a quick overnight trip to San Franscisco. The hotel is Rey conveniently located right in the heart of the business district. The staff was exceptionally courteous and the property was great. My room was quite small since this is an older property but the room was nicely furnished, clean and quiet. What more can you ask for when traveling on business?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: gybruin
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to the Galleria for 15 years for business. My travel budget would allow me to spend more and stay at other hotels, but I stay at the Galleria. Why? It's a great location. In the financial district, a block from Bart, several great restaurants and convenient to work. The hotel is old and has character. So the rooms are smaller but comfortable enough for the few hours I spend there. The wash basins are extra large. The bedding cover are sheets and so everything you touch on the bed is clean. They provide plenty of pillows and a robe. One of my favorite things is in the evening, there is complimentary wine service in the lobby. It's nice to walk in and see a crowd there relaxing and chatting at the end of a work day. The desk clerks have turned over of course over the years. I don't have a favorite one right now but in the past there were some great ones. One downside of the location is that it can be noisy at night and early morning with the trash trucks. So ask for an inside room if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: We found the staff anxious to be of help. They accommodated our request for a connecting room even though we had a late arrival. The location is excellent for business and pleasure (we were doing both.) The staff was very efficient in getting us information and reservations for tours and transportation. They stored our luggage after check out which was helpful. Except for the rainy weather our trip was perfect. We were unable to try the wine reception or the hotel restaurant. We had breakfast at the small place on the corner and enjoyed that.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JenniW5
Reviews.Content: This is really a combination "business" and "couples" review. I was in SF for a business conference, accompanied by my husband and another couple. The Galleria Park was a few blocks from my conference, but the rooms cost less than half of what the cost would have been at the conference hotel, plus we had free wireless internet access. Each couple had a king bed room; size was "urban" but ample, with an easy chair and a nice bathroom. We loved the unique decor and especially enjoyed the roof garden terrace. Location near Union Square was perfect for where I needed to be and for accessing public transportation to anywhere else in the city. The wine receptions were a nice touch. Breakfast on premises was expensive, but a good coffee shop is right next door. The staff was great. Highly recommend and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and great desk staff...but loud mornings!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun-tb11
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I stayed in town on business and was very pleased with the service of the staff at the front desk who seemed to be very accommodating and hospitable, as were the bell hops and wine servers. The complimentary wine hour each evening was a nice touch and a great way to network and meet fellow guests. Centrally located and within a reasonable distance to the financial district and union square - it was very accessible. The only reason I didn't give it five stars was because the cleaning staff were very loud in the mornings and begun banging on doors extremely early (around 8am) to begin cleaning. I had to leave my "privacy" sign up the entire length of my stay. Also our room was right next to the service elevator, which was unfortunate. Also beware, the walls are very thin so you can hear EVERYTHING your neighbors say or do but if you're fairly quiet (which I am), not in the room much (which was my case) and you have quiet neighbors (which I thankfully did) it's not a huge deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paheather
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exquisite! The staff was so friendly! I stayed with them for 1 night in March and I LOVED my experience. Located in a perfect central SF spot within walking distance to many local attractions including the ferry building, chinatown and museums. The room I stayed in was so cozy and comfy It felt like I was staying in my own apartment. Sadly I missed breakfast so I can't comment on the food/room service. If you're looking for an amazing experience look no further!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with the nicest, most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: We traveled from the UK and stayed at the Galleria Park for 10 days. We couldn't have had a better time at this lovely hotel. Before we arrived I emailed with various questions about the city and also with a very particular request- my little boy had his piano exam on his return so I wrote to ask if the hotel had a piano which he could practice on. Molly from the hotel sent a lovely email to say no they didn't but that she would more than happy to bring her own keyboard in from home and put it in the room- which she duly did. So we knew before we even arrived that the staff were going to be kind, courteous and willing to go the extra mile to make our stay memorable. They couldn't do enough for us that week and all requests- from restaurant tips to advice on getting around the city were always dealt with with friendliness and a smile. They took the time and trouble to get us, my mum and our 8 year old brilliant and thoughtful goodie bags- the giant pencil made his day! The maids would cuddle our son's teddies together in a lovely way each day. They all made it a really special experience for us. The hotel itself is gorgeous and we were more than comfortable during our stay. Great beds, perfect temperature in the room, exceptionally clean, free wi-fi and all nice fittings. We enjoyed the complimentary wine in the evenings as we chatted to lots of new people and also really liked the running track on Level 3- a great place to eat picnics and chat. Also great for smokers. The location was perfect for us- there is so much to do in that beautiful city and we walked or took public transport every day. The hotel is really close to Chinatown as well as the Muni and cable car stops and it was a perfect place to explore from. We were really sad to leave at the end of our stay- they made it a home from home and we would love to stay there again. Can't recommend it enough- thank you everyone at the Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: minihoneymooner
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying at Galleria Park, it is centrally located and cozy. I also really liked the decor, although my husband disagreed. Above all it was really clean; the all white bathroom sparkled! Would definitely recommend this to anyone staying in San Fran on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: jpio
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last minute res for a business trip to SF, and really lucked out with the Galleria Park!. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. The room was a King size bed with a room around it, but that is pretty common with older, renovated buildings. Very nice, and clean. Other than the showerhead, which was configured for someone around 4'10", everything was fantastic. I can't say enough good about this place. Clean, good food, and a courteous, knowledgeable staff. I couldn't ask for more. The location is great if your biz is downtown. I'll stay there again in a second. Thank you Galleria Park. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable stay, helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: PragueMarti
Reviews.Content: After staying for 5 nights at the Clift on a business trip i moved to Galleria Park for the weekend for my personal stay in San Francisco. I must say that even though the rate I paid at Galleria Park was only 1/3 of the price of the Clift (though I believe it was a special reduced rate) my stay here was much more comfortable. First I had an embarrassing moment at the reception during check in - even though i had sufficient funds in cash, my credit cards were maxed up after paying unexpectedly large sums for some business events my employer organized in SF. The credit card, however, was necessary for the check in but the reception supervisor managed to tweak the system and check me in she was so pleasant that I didn't feel like a poor relation (much ;-)). The room was clean, cozy, with a comfortable bed, very quiet (unlike the Clift), complimentary wifi, nice products in the bathroom (Lather). Great location - took me about 5 minutes to walk to Union Square, 3 minutes to Chinatown and maybe 15 minutes to walk to Ferry Building.

Reviews.Title: “Old city hotel - city prices”
Reviews.Author: David_in_New_Jersey
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Galleria Park and it probably won't be my last as it's in an extremely convenient location. It's just feet from one of my companies offices and 1 block from the BART. It's a nice part of downtown San Francisco and walking to many places is very convenient. It's an old hotel. The bed and room appeared to be clean and kept up well, but it's an old hotel. The rooms are small with minimal amenities. The price though isn't small with a hefty nightly cost. Staff was always friendly and attentive. I had a room on the 5th floor and it was an outside corner. The wifi signal in the room was very week and often there was a hard time connecting and frequent drops. I don't know if an inside room or other location on the floor would be better, but the room I had was poor for wifi. At least wifi is included in the high room price. There's a nice size flat screen TV in the room, but the channel selection was poor. It's a HD TV and I'm sure there's HD service available, yet all channels were SD and stretched to fit the 16:9 screen. Compare this to a hotel I stayed in the following weekend that was 1/3 the cost, 4x the room size and 4x the channel selection with most channels being HD. other than that there was nothing special about the room, which would be fine if the price was 1/2 what it was. I wouldn't stay there on a personal trip, but I will stay there on future business trips just because of the huge convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park Hotel - great for couples, business and famillies”
Reviews.Author: dianesharp7
Reviews.Content: Even though I live in the Bay Area, one of my favorite things to do is spend a night or two in The City. I love all the Joie de Vivre hotels, but this was our first time staying at the Galleria Park. It is wonderful! The hotel has a great "vibe" of course (don't all the Joie de Vivre hotels?), but it also is super practical. It's just a block or so from Union Square in one direction, a few blocks from Chinatown, and a nice short walk to the Ferry Building/Embarcadero (my favorite place to walk and hang-out ... go to the Cowgirl Creamery for the best cheese ever). We were there with our two children, so we sprung for one of the suites - it was amazing (and no more expensive than reserving two regular hotel rooms at some nearby hotels)! There was a main room with a working fireplace, couch and table (plus a beautiful bedroom). The linens are perfect as are the pillows, and I love the soaps/lotions etc. Three of my favorite things about the Galleria Park: 1) The 3rd floor outdoor area (with a little walking track and lots of places to sit and read a newspaper or bring a lunch) 2) The wine hour every night in the lobby 3) The staff (warm and helpful) We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: farley170
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for new year & was amazed on its location & how quiet the rooms where. The staff was so efficent & friendley we are regular travellers to the usa & we will definetely stay again & recommend to our friends & family. The rooms are so peacefull, we got a great deal through hotels.com. i would like to thank the managment team on your excellent service , although you are a hotel chain we loved your attention to detail which is often lacking in hotel chains. The wine evenings was also a great way of meeting people. Karen & Stewart Tittley, united kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay while visiting Union Square in SF”
Reviews.Author: mx m
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, awesome staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “VERY COMFORTABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Blubell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly placed for discovering San Francisco which we took full advantage of. We were given a room facing in and although it was very quiet, after 6 nights we did feel a little claustrophobic as the room was very dark even with bright sunlight so if you need more light in your room do ask for a room facing the street. We would do that next time. However the room itself was extremely comfortable and had everything you would need. The wine hour is a nice touch and the reception staff couldnt have been more accommodating. Tip: take the No.38 bus from Union Square, ride it (for $2) all the way to the end of the line and you come to a fantastic stretch of Beach and the Pacific Ocean. Its called Ocean Beach and has a wonderful deco restaurant there called Cliff House. It also has parks etc to relax in. So should you want to get away from the city for a day and it makes for a lovely trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a very quiet room. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Callyoz
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this hotel arriving very early after an overnight flight from Anchorage. We were prepared to drop our luggage and try and find somewhere to rest until we could check in but the wonderful reception staff allowed us into our room for a very early check in. As the room had a internal aspect, it was super quite and very dark. We were able to get a few hours sleep before hitting San Francisco sights in earnest. The hotel is an easy walk to Union Square and we bought passes for the open top bus for five days and really took advantage of these. The room and bathroom was clean and comfortable. The hotel nicely decorated throughout. Unfortunately I would not recommend the restaurant situated in the hotel...the staff were snooty, unfriendly and in no way helpful with the menu options. I would however recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: tinydogtoo
Reviews.Content: i stay at this hotel frequently for business (and sometimes a couple extra days for fun!). the staff is very pleasant and always ready to help. the rooms are nice, clean and modern (although some can be a little small). i also really appreciate the "green"-ness of the hotel. the work out room could use a little help but there is a nice outdoor area available on the 3rd fl if you don't want to get your excercise walking the hills of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: Cindy M
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in the Galleria Park for many years and I find the room comfortable, clean with all the amenities. The staff from the front desk, reservations, housekeeping and doorman are outstanding, friendly and knowledgable about the area. The beautiful rooftop garden is a great place to unwind and the nightly wine service gives guests a chance to mingle, read by the fireplace or just enjoy the atmosphere. All of this and the location is perfect for exploring any part of the City and/or working in the financial district. If you make the Galleria Park your first choice for your next SF visit...you'll never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sedillo
Reviews.Content: This place is really pretty. We didn't actually stay here but used the bathroom during the Chinese New Year's Parade. They were very accommodating for a pregnant lady that was not even a guest of theirs (me)! I would highly recommend staying here for a Geary St-facing room for the Chinese News Years Parade as it is in the prime location. We will probably do that next time instead of paying $30/person for bleacher seats plus public transportation. Thanks Galleria Park for helping me in an emergency!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: sportwife
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a reasonably priced hotel in San Francisco is always tough. Just spent 3 nights at the Galleria Park, and will return to this hotel. My only complaint is the noise level with the rooms that face the street. Next time I will request an interior room. And the bath set up was a bit strange..the sink was in the room, and the shower was really tiny! But the employees were very nice, the bed was comfy, and overall a great location. Several places nearby for a quick healthy breakfast. I really could not have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st Stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: lcamano
Reviews.Content: Great place, Great people! We were first timers to San Francisco and the location of Galleria Park was just perfect! We were able to walk to almost everywhere we wanted which was a huge part of the charm of San Francisco for us. We visited China Town (3 blocks) North Beach with fabulous Italian Food and Pubs (about 10 blocks) Union Square (right around the corner) we toured Alcatraz ( a bit of a walk but we survived ) and the Ferry Building too (just a few blocks away). The only place we had to taxi to was Asbury Haight (well worth the trip). The hotel is in a beautiful old building that combined some old world charm (marble stairways) with modern luxuries (Frette linens). The bed was comfortable and our 5th floor room was pretty quiet for city life. The front desk staff were fun and informative, offering great suggestions for restaurants and public transit options, they even held our bags so we could check out but still explore until our flight out. The only downside was that we kept missing the evening wine reception so we will just have to come back. Can't wait! We truly had a GREAT time! Thanks Galleria!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Christina H
Reviews.Content: I randomly stayed at this Hotel and was very pleasantly surprised. The location is only a couple easy blocks from Union Square and all the shopping you could want. The staff was unbelievably nice. I was there for my birthday weekend, and they even wished me happy birthday on my actual birthday! They were super helpful in suggesting things to do and places to eat. The room was smaller, but I didn't mind that cause I didn't go to San Francisco to just sit in my hotel. It was very nice though with nice flat screen TV, clean, and comfortable bed. Also had a big closet which was very nice. The hotel felt newer/renovated, and very hip and modern. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected find”
Reviews.Author: vesperPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel for those tired of the large chains. Wonderful personal service and attention to detail. The property was immaculate and in a great location close to everything. Will definitely return when business brings me back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish boutique hotel for business.”
Reviews.Author: samanthaonstyle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Galleria Park for two nights on business, and I was very satisfied with my stay! Overall, it's a clean, comfortable, stylish boutique hotel in a superb location, for an excellent price. ROOM: I stayed in an Executive Queen, and it was perfectly fine for a solo business traveler. While the room was a bit dark and a little smaller than average, it had plenty of room to move around, and the bed was very fluffy and comfortable. The huge walk-in closet helps hide your suitcase so you don't feel as cramped. If you're a couple, you probably will want to upgrade to a king room or larger, though the queen was just fine for a quick business trip. The Internet was a little slow, but it was free, so I can't complain! BATHROOM: The bathroom was clean and standard with a tub and shower curtain, though little storage space. It did need more shelves or drawers or a medicine cabinet or something, but that's not a dealbreaker. AMENITIES: The hotel boasts a number of useful boutique amenities, such as a complimentary wine happy hour and a fitness room. It also had an outdoor garden/track on the third floor, and I would've used it if I'd had leisure time. The room had an ample mini bar, and although it would have been nice if the water bottles in the room had been complimentary instead of $5, there's a 7-Eleven on the next block, as well as a coffee shop and an Asian-Mexican fusion cafe on either side of the hotel. SERVICE: The service was very attentive and friendly and the front desk was always helpful with giving directions, getting taxis, etc. I had booked rooms for a number of colleagues, on various credit cards, and the hotel made everything very easy, and correct! LOCATION: You can't beat the location, right near Union Square and the Financial District and walking distance to major areas/attractions in the city. I may want a little more space/light if I'm traveling to SF for leisure or have a larger budget. However, I was very pleased with my stay and I'd stay at the Galleria Park again, especially considering the excellent value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Zach C. is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: casey b
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations, guest services, free wine reception every day and an ideal location! Zach C. at the front desk was very helpful recommending restaurants and nightlife to celebrate my best friend's and my 21st birthday. Very personable, professional, and seemed genuinely interested in making sure our stay exceeded our expectations-- which is did. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Went for business but would stay for a fun trip to SF too!”
Reviews.Author: wp52
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel. I stayed here for a short business trip, wish I could have stayed longer. Very close to the financial district and an easy walk to BART and many great restaurants. The restaurant (Hecho) looked fabulous and if I didn't have dinner plans with business associates I surely would have eaten here. Since I was traveling alone Hecho looked like a place where I could eat alone and not be uncomfortable and the sushi looked so good! I was upgraded to a suite at no additional charge. It was a very large room with a separate living area that had a great desk for work and even a small table with four chairs, very spacious. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel staff were very helpful in giving me directions to where I needed to be and were all very friendly. Very comfortable bed with nice linens!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Olivier D
Reviews.Content: Nice room, not very large but sufficient. Did appreciate the Cofee in the morning and wine in the evening Location perfect: a few blocks from chinatown, union square and BART Station, 10 minutes walking from moscone center. Did nolt try the Hecho restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean, and attractive room”
Reviews.Author: cheetobronze
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with our 3 kids stayed here and enjoyed all aspects of the hotel. From the very friendly and helpful staff, to the hotel room that was larger and cleaner than most in S.F. We truly enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: We relocated here at short notice after another hotel didn't work out, and were really glad we did. We're big fans of their hotel in Santa Cruz - the Dream Inn - and the Galleria Park provides the same quality rooms and great service. The rooms aren't huge, but they're well-appointed, with very comfortable beds. The staff are fantastic - extremely friendly and accommodating, from desk staff to bellhop. There's a very welcome open terrance on the third floor. There's no bar, but it's connected to an excellent sushi restaurant (which also provides breakfast, and does room service up until 10:00pm) and right next door to a very good coffee and sandwich shop - not to mention being half a block from a La Boulange. Five minutes from great shopping, Union Square, China town... It'd be hard to get me to stay anywhere else in the city now.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection Location, Fabulous Staff, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angie S
Reviews.Content: What can I say other than this hotel exceeded my expectations. The location of the hotel is great. I was a bit nervous due to the outside noise, but once I was in the hotel and also in my room I couldn't ear any of it. The staff was very friendly at check in and throughout my stay. Gave excellent restaurant referrals and was more than willing to secure us a reservations or transporation. The hotel was beautiful decorated. After staying at this intimate boutique hotel I now have a fondess for boutique hotels and will continue to stay at boutique hotels over large chain style hotels. I look forward to my next SF trip and will stay at the Galleria Park Hotel every time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: PS_S_s3452
Reviews.Content: I stay in San Francisco 2 nights a week every week and have for over 7 years. Over that time I have tried many hotels , and I have to say Galleria Park is my choice. Big enough to have the facilities you want but small enough to still be personal and care. The attitude of the staff and the accommodating service are what mark the property out as special. Nice sheets and big comfortable beds. Inner rooms are quieter but you are in the city so expect some noise if you have a room on the street side. They do get busy when there is a big conference inn town so make sure you book early on those weeks. For the price it is pretty much unbeatable if you journey takes you downtown to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location. Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: shaksisland
Reviews.Content: My husband was on a business trip while me and our baby joined him to San Francisco to tour the city. Both myself and my husband were very pleased staying at Galleria hotel. Room: We were given a room with a King size bed and also a crib with wheels to easily move around the room - I like that :) Although the room wasn't very big but it was good enough for us and the baby especially that our baby has just started walking, it was good enough for her to take a few steps here and there! Staff: The staff were very friendly. From the moment we were met at the front desk till we left, each and every member of the staff we have spoken to was very friendly and cooperative. They helped me with the stroller every time I was in or out of the hotel. Few times where there wasn't someone close to the door to help but then the receptionist would step forward and help me. Tours: I asked the hotel if they know any tours i can take and they helped me with looking at different Hop on Hop off bus tours. After I have done a little research, I decided to book one through them and it turned out to a great bus tour (The open top bus tour) It was $40 for 48 hours hop on hop off bus tour, I paid $15 at the hotel and the rest was paid when I took the bus. The hotel has a very elegant lobby that I really liked. Never waited too long for the elevators. There's a track for jogging on the 3rd floor and a workout out room, unfortunately I haven't checked them out. Location: The hotel is so close to union square where you can take the bus tours (infornt of Macys) and also so close to Market street where Westfield mall is and a lot of stores. The are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the neighborhood. China town is only a few blocks away. It was a marvelous stay at the hotel. We had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deborah m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to San Francisco for a family wedding. Arrangements had been made for us by the wedding party. Check-in was a pleasure....our room was ready early, the staff was so friendly and helpful. Everytime we came downstairs to the lobby someone greeted us...very often by name, asked what we had planned for the day...made suggestions. We felt really comfortable and very welcome. Our room was lovely and the hotel was so centrally located that we were able to walk to the metro and bart or to pick up a local bus. We look forward to returning to this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Galleria Park Hotel in San Francisco the last few visits to the city. The hotel is perfectly located close to all that the city has to offer whether you are staying on business or pleasure. The guest rooms are beautiful and the hotel staff is fantastic. I give the hotel five stars and would highly suggest you book a room upon your next trip to the city. The Galleria Park Hotel is all that a boutique hotel should be.....unique and special. A true San Francisco gem!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jenniffer123
Reviews.Content: Rude did not accommodate my needs. I stay in San Francisco did not want and tried to refuse me service after I prepaid and would not let me extend.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Sondra K
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at the Galleria Park Hotel, where they treat me like family. It is a hotel with wonderful personality - funky, classy and comfortable. The place has character, but in an understated way. They don't try too hard or go over the top. The location is good for both business and fun. It's in the heart of the Financial district and very close to Union Square. The staff is warm, thoughtful and obviously empowered to make every guest happy. A true gem in a fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: LHardy
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reading the other reviews, but decided to take a chance. I love this hotel. It was 'warm' and friendly and the crew at the front desk and valet were wonderful. I didn't have a need to seek out the housekeeping dept., but that is because the room could not have been cleaner or more comfortable. There were only 2 minor changes I would make and for most people they would not even be a thought. One was the shower curtain - it would make it so much better if they put in a half circle curtain rod instead of the straight across one they now have. It would keep the curtain from sticking to the person showering. The other thing is a better toilet - one that is 'elongated'. I did not have the problem with the noise that was in the other reviews and I believe it is because I expect there to be ER vehicles and trolley car noises. The bed was wonderful and the closet was huge. I Do NOT recommend the restaurant though.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: savann8h
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Union Square at the Galleria Park Hotel in San Francisco. I was there for the week for business. It's in a great location with an easy walk down to Market where the shops are and just around the corner to great restaurants and offices. My first morning there before a big presentation I realized I'd forgotten deodorant. I called the front desk to ask where I could find a drug store and they ran a full size brand name deodorant right up to me with no charge. When I had to leave a day early due to an unexpected storm hitting the northeast they let me check out early without a penalty. They were extremely helpful and accommodating. They were also helpful with cabs, directions, etc... The room was beautiful with various shades of blue-green, the bed was extremely comfortable, they have limited room service, and the latest in-room movies. I had a great stay and will definitely go again. They also offer evening wine receptions and complimentary/coffee tea in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: babydds1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 2011 the night of a Sting concert. I love the boutique feel of this hotel--and the wine in the evening and coffee in the morning. Ate at the sushi place next door. It was kind of pricey, but good. Had some amazing margaritas there. I would definitely return--slept well in a comfortable bed :) Booked through Priceline--name your price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cris S
Reviews.Content: We were there 1 week ago with the whole family and had a great time. The location couldn't be more perfect! We just walked to Union Square and to Chinatown. Check in was smooth and easy. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean with very comfortable bed and fluffy pillows. We asked for extra blankets and pillows and got a swift response. The kids were happy with the free wifi and the HDTVs. We really enjoyed our stay and will surely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, boutique and nice”
Reviews.Author: AzCarolTucson
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times including last year for Chinese new year...what a view! This was for work and it is still a great place. Close to union square, not a place for little kids, but great for grown ups with the wine hour, close to restaurants and shopping...and BART. Nice staff, several I recalled form last February when I stayed there. I would recommend this local chain joie de vivre as well.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely small hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara-Jerry
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in for a three night stay until we left, we were always greeted with friendly smiles and hellos whenever we passed the front desk. The lobby is warm and inviting with comfortable chairs and sofas and a fireplace. There are even comfy chairs by the front entrance. Wine is served every evening. Unfortunately because of our schedule we did not get a chance to partake. Our queen deluxe room was not spacious but it was most accomodating with a closet, drawers, refrigerator, safe, desk with chair and another chair with an ottoman. Bathroom was clean and roomy. When we had trouble with our tv remote, someone came to the room promptly to replace it. The front desk staff and doormen graciously answered all our questions. The restaurant affiliated with the hotel was very expensive, so we walked a block for a delicious breakfast in the morning (le bolange). Also hotel provided coffee service every morning on the mezzanine - delicious coffee by the way. There is also a lovely outdoor area with benches and oval track. My husband and I (seniors) would definitely stay here again. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Galleria Park Hotel is my "go to" choice for hotels in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Tara J
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Galleria Park Hotel for the 2nd time this past weekend. The 1st time I stayed in this hotel was last year and I was immediately impressed upon entering the facilities. The decor in the lobby is very inviting and clean which provides for a very welcoming environment. As soon as you enter the staff on hand immediately greet you and ask what they can assist you with. All of the staff that I have come in contact with are very professional and eager to help. The actual rooms in the hotel are also consistent with the lobby...very clean and decorated with modern yet classic pieces. Not to mention the hotel is walking distance from EVERYTHING may it be the BART, Chinatown, Little Italy, Fisherman's Wharf etc. The surrounding area of the hotel is very safe and clean as well. Anytime I go to SF I plan to stay at this hotel. Also during my trip this past weekend a group of friends joined me and they stayed in the hotel as well. They also gushed about how conveniently located and "cool" the ambiance was. You can't go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “"An outstanding find"”
Reviews.Author: Jsalem07
Reviews.Content: 5 quick things why we liked the hotel: 1. Smooth Check-in - After driving from LA for many hours, we were greeted by upbeat and mood-lifting front desk agents - Richard and Zach. Both provided a warm atmosphere after a long cold drive. Check-in was seamless and competent. 2. Clean room and bathroom - My favorite was the bed and sheets. Pillows were the best , thus far. Comfy! 3. Really delighted to see a pair of 46" LG LCD HDTV, one in the bedroom and living room. There was also an impressive size desk in the corner office for the workaholic. 4. Free stuff whereas other hotels would charge - Wine hour - 5:30 everyday. Guests would pack the lobby for this, and free wireless internet 5. Location - shopping paradise the moment you step out; Chinatown very close, restaurants, Union Square, financial district, trolley stops, etc. all within comfortable walking distance. Wife really enjoyed the close proximity of the high end stores like Burberry, 7 jeans, Bulgari and Neiman Marcus to name a few. 6. Price- reasonable for everything that you would get. Saved on wine, internet charges, cab fares. Will highly recommend to friends and family. Galleria Park found a loyal guest here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Dots75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and had a very enjoyable experience. The rooms are a bit small but we were never in the room. The location of the hotel can not be beat. Its a perfect location with access to wonderful bars, restaurants and shopping. There is a great little coffee shop/cafe at the corner that we always started our day off at. The staff at the hotel were very helpfully and friendly. The decor of the lobby and main area is very nice. The rooms could use a little refurbishing but still not bad. Overall, great experience and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: joel s
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and professional, they made sure that everything was taking care of, and the place is perfect. the spot is awesome ! close to union square, malls, chinatown. don't mind coming back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TheManInBlack19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in December 2011. We booked The Galleria Park based on the reviews from the Tripadvisor community, and we're glad we did. It was a real find, and excellent value for money. The hotel was clean, room was sizeable (we got upgraded when the reception staff found out we were on honeymoon), staff were very friendly (everyone in San Francisco seems to be friendly), and the location is perfect - 2 minutes walk from Union Square, Market St, and the Chinatown Gate on Grant. It is also really easy to get to the hotel from the airport. Just take the BART to Montgomery St and it's a 5 minute walk from there. Beware of the stairs at Montgomery St. The escalators didn't seem to work when we were there, and our suitcases were fairly heavy! The hotel has a really nice wine reception each evening from 5.30-6.30pm, where they invite representatives from the Napa Valley wineries in to showcase their wares. It's a great chance to sample decent quality wines from the region, and it's included in the room price. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barl0w1
Reviews.Content: Room was small. Nicely designed. Rate was quite high, but was there for a few days including New Year's Eve, so that may have driven the up price. It did seem expensive for the size of room. Staff are excellent. Great attitude and very helpful. Great location in a nice area. Coffee machine had just one caffeinated and one decaffeinated pod- with a charge for more-seems a bit petty. Nice Shampoo soap etc.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: 21SAS
Reviews.Content: Stay 4 days there at a price of 3, and I must say it is really enjoyable experience. The room is a little small for 2 queen size bed, so the person sleeping nearest to the toilet may be disturbed in the night, but everything else is excellent - modern and stylish, union square, long beach, fisherman wharf are well within walking range, helpful and courtesy staff, complimentary drinks in the morning and early evening...

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a very convenient location for shops and restaurants..”
Reviews.Author: Susan F
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant hotel. We like its high standard in cleanliness, its very friendly staff and the complimentary wine at 5.30 in the afternoon. We compared prices with other hotels nearby and this hotel is excellent value for money at the time we made the booking.

Reviews.Title: “Small but fine”
Reviews.Author: WTGZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely stylish with its silver and blue tones. It was nice walking back in to see the fireplace...especially given that it's Christmas. Stayed 3 nights in a king. Given a quiet room in back = no view..unless u count the naked guy opposite..yes you can see the neighbors. But will recommend due to street noise. Bathroom was oldish but recently renovated. Sparkly clean...no faulting the cleanliness here. Loved the toiletries, the wine hour, gym and park. The location of the hotel ,which means you are close to everything without being in Union Square. Would spring for a bigger room next time. Loved the artwork all around the rooms and hotel. Gives it personality.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet gem in the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: John95628
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st stay at the Galleria Park. I had high expectations, and still was surprised and impressed. The hotel is two blocks from Union Square, maybe a five minute walk. And 1 block from a Bart station. Location wise it's in the epicenter of San Francisco shopping. The hotel is subtle and pleasant. It looks recently remodeled, and it's certainly not bland. Everything seems new and (most important) extremely clean. The front desk staff go out of their way to be helpful, and it's genuine. The lobby is modern but in gentle colors. With the hotel rooms, it's the little touches that add up. A large closet with a robe, ironing board and iron, and umbrella. The bathroom has a large tub. The furniture in the room seems new, and is comfortable. The colors are subtle and rich. My room (facing the interior) was silent day and night. Positives: Location, extreme cleanliness, reasonable price, newness and high quality of furnishings, staff. Negatives: ....I can't think of one!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: ShawnConna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here right before the winter holidays and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The Snow Day pkg was great, and the location is centrally located and near to everything. We especially loved the terrace on the third floor, which is a sophisticated slice of park paradise in the urban jungle of downtown SF. The staff was wonderful as well, and my only complaint is that the rooms were very tiny, even by SF standards. luckily, we spent little time in the room, so it all worked out. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: simmonsgottlieb
Reviews.Content: Great place to land when walking all over San Francisco. Wine reception and walking terrace add to the many amenities available.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Monzingo
Reviews.Content: We travel to SF every year and have stayed in many different hotels(all have been good). I couldn't get in to usual spot so tried Galleria, and was very pleased. will stay there again. The location was great. Aprox 2 blocks from Muni, 1/2 block from Claude Alley and Belden Place restaurants, next door to Crocker Galleria which has Farmer's Market,walk to Union Square, etc. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Wine in the late afternoon was a nice touch. Our room was very large with fun decor and the bathroom was also large and had the best lighting I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: zippadeedoodah
Reviews.Content: Loved it all. The bright lively staff. The great bathrooms, location, price. Just felt completely renewed after only 4 days. I had been really down and I was there by myself just being myself doing what I want when I want and it was just the right place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: MEhlers
Reviews.Content: GPH is my home away from home when I need to be in SF for business. From the well-situated rooms to the friendly, dependable staff to the excellent location, GPH is the only hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: GingerSanMateo
Reviews.Content: I received an email promotion offering a great rate for a Saturday night stay during High Season Christmas shopping time at Union Square. We make appoint to stay in the city every year for Christmas! This little boutique hotel was unbelievable!! Beautifully decorated and so incredibly convenient to Union Square and dining!!! And the outdoor garden area was lovely!! Staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel! Great value for the money and a wonderful experience all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all rooms and prices with a friendly front desk”
Reviews.Author: YoPedro
Reviews.Content: I booked the Galleria Park through my conference (AGU) and was pleased with the experience. The hotel is in an excellent walkable spot with easy access to everywhere downtown. The room was quiet and comfortable though the bed cover was a bit lightweight. The front desk staff were very friendly and apparently the offered a free evening wine reception and coffee morning which was a kind gesture but didn't help me since I don't drink wine or coffee. Donuts and hot chocolate would have been better. I would stay here again. I hope this is a helpful review for you.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: dawn_coyote
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in San Francisco for the AGU fall meeting that happens annually. I have really enjoyed every hotel I stayed in (Orchard, Omni, Seal Point Inn, Marriott) - but there is something a little more personal about the Galleria Park that I really liked. Its very covenient for the Moscone and although the room I had was quite small with not much view (just a regular Queen), I felt that I didn't need any more room than that because it was so well-put together. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. I expect to return to this one! That's a 4.8 rather than a 5 ---- clock radio didn't work and was a bit grubby.

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park Staff and Management are Winners! Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: Dave V
Reviews.Content: In late August I was in San Francisco for the Giant Race half marathon at AT&T Park. I made arrangements to stay at the Galleria Park Hotel ("GPH") for the night before the race. When I went to check in at the hotel, the staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. This all was great but the real surprise came when I went to my room. Approaching my room, I noticed that the staff had decorated the doorway in a "finish line" motif with ribbon and other decorations. Entering the room, I discovered that the staff had thoughtfully (and quite creatively) carried the race theme into the room with more ribbon, checkered flags, bottled waters and energy bars provided for me. They even included a sweet note of encouragement for my race. The room was comfortable, clean and well-appointed. I simply couldnt get over how thoughtful the staff and management had been and how much effort that they had gone through to make my stay special. It was a great start to a great race too!! I have since told countless people of my experience and the extra mile that everyone at the GPH went to for me. Service and thoughtfulness like this needs to be recognized and commended, especially in this day and age when "customer accommodation" is too often a forgotten thing. Many thanks to everyone at the GPH, and keep up the great work!!! You guys are all awesome and definitely WINNERS!! Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: pensoso
Reviews.Content: JDV hotels are my favorite and I normally stay at the Hotel Rex. This trip the Galleria Park worked better with the budget and I was happily surprised and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: Bart J
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel i cant say enough. I contacted the hotel weeks before we arrived & was put in contact with Galen from the front desk. We mustve exchanged about 10 emails about things to do etc. ON arrival he had bumped us up to a junior suite & had a package waiting for us at the hotel. This had maps of all the areas with areas marked where we shouldnt go. Things we could do & all sorts. Plus he advised us to buy a Muni passport which gives you unlimited travel on the various forms of public transport. This was a godsend. I wouldnt advise to drive in SF but use the various forms of transport including the streetcars & cable cars. The rest of the staff at the hotel were equally as nice constantly helping where they could. Joel who is the front desk manager even booked & printed out tickets for us for a show we were going to see in LA even though it had nothing to do with his hotel. The rooms were great too, nice big flat screen tv, clean, huge bed too. Location is perfect as you are on the doorstep of Union Square & Chinatown. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdxtraveler79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, while working on lower Market Street. I typically stay at bigger chain hotels (I'm a slave to points), but decided to try this hotel given its location and reasonable price. I loved this hotel! The reception personnel were very friendly and helpful, and they willingly threw band aids at me for two days after I sliced my finger. The room itself was quite spacious, and it had a good work area with plenty of outlets, which is so rare in older hotels. The bed and linens were top notch. The bathroom was very clean, but small, as would be expected in an older hotel. I had a room that overlooked an inner courtyard, and it was very quiet. I also barely heard any noise from other rooms, which is another benefit of an older hotel with thicker walls and doors. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: mulberry888
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel from 29th Oct - 5th Nov. The hotel staff if great, very friendly and accomodating. Location is great, near a lot of public transportations. Many Walgreens nearby and even a 7-11 shop on next street. Though our room is facing Sutter street, it is not too noisy. Once a while can hear car horns or sirens but usually after 10pm it's ok. The only complain I have is the bed. Everytime my hubby move, even a tiniest bit, I will feel it! Wish the hotel would get better quality beds. but overall it's a good place to stay and I would most probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: seckam
Reviews.Content: Friendly reception and very accomodating. We arrived 2hrs earlier and was checked-in without any hassle. Great location, near BART. Everything we asked for and even more. Though room was a tad small, the cleanliness and HUGE flat screen TV made up for it. We stayed for 4 nights and was only disturbed from the street noise once. They allowed us to leave our suitcase at the premises when we checked out and left for Hawaii for a few days without any charges. This has exceeded our expectations. We would most certainly use this hotel on our future trips and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Sent here due to overbooking at adagio hotel”
Reviews.Author: clivebear
Reviews.Content: Room was small.clutered with too much furniture.... Check was ok...but wine reception going on so couldnt here a thing... Bathroom towels basic/its noisy street side... Very average...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pagavin
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and lovely room with attention to details and interesting colors. Free daily wine reception was an added plus and a nice way to meet fellow guests. Very convenient to BART, bus and sreetcar lines as well as Union Square. Big flat screen TV and radio in room. Bed very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: leslieinsf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights recently and it was almost flawless. I'm a San Franciscan who moved away, and I was visiting for 11 days. I have plenty of friends I could stay with in the Bay Area, but I wanted a few days on my own for my birthday. I'd been looking at options when I realized I had a bunch of miles I could use, and that's how I found the Galleria Park. It was perfect. The lobby is gorgeous, and I was greeted by friendly and efficient staff. When I let the guy checking me in know it was my birthday, he made sure to give me the best room possible -- and it was great. The rooms are not large (though from other reviews, some are smaller than others), but they're beautifully done, with attention to detail. For instance, the desk had a round surge protector fastened on top, so there was no climbing around looking for enough plugs for my different electronics. The desk chair was a beautiful and comfortable office chair. The flat screen TV was large, and there was a good selection of channels. The bed was comfortable, and there was aircon/fan plus the windows actually opened, too. Top quality linens as well. They really have it together. Room service is during limited hours, from the restaurant downstairs, Hecho, an interesting combination of sushi and tequila. I had Japanese dinner one evening, and it arrived quickly and was good, and one morning I ordered breakfast, also delicious and delivered promptly with a smile. Expensive, yes, but room service always is, and hey, it was my birthday. Maid service was excellent, too, and again, the guys at the front desk were great. The location is easy - just a few short blocks walk to Union Square, and many high-end stores are on the way. There are countless restaurants nearby, including sushi, fast food, old-school San Francisco places, and the restaurants of Belden Alley. You're just a couple of blocks from Chinatown, and there are buses galore nearby. BART is just a couple of blocks so you can get to either airport easily. This time, I used my miles to stay at the Galleria Park, but it would have been worth the money, too. I can see this becoming my regular San Francisco treat-myself-to-a-retreat base.

Reviews.Title: “san francisco 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: deb g
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Galleria on our 3 nights, it was a good hotel basic and bit on the expensive side for what it was. I think if you stay in San Fran stay near the Wharf. This hotel was in the business district but close enough to walk to China Town. Staff were a bit aloof and unfriendly. If you are going to alcatraz you better prebook. We prebooked luckily as it was sold out 3 days ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Andrea M
Reviews.Content: Convenient and safe location; extremely helpful and friendly staff; great room and property.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, not-so-great room.”
Reviews.Author: cup4drw
Reviews.Content: Pros: Everyone that I met there (reception, valet, maids) was very very nice. Wine Reception was fun each night. Bed was comfortable. Price was pretty good for the location. Cons: Bathroom was a little scary - didn't really want to walk on that nasty tile in bare feet. Although wifi was free, it was actually much slower than my AT&T 3G. The worst problem was the cooling system. Even though it was brisk outside, the room was hot. Not feasible to open the window at night because of the noise. The AC was bad. It barely cooled the room. And worse yet, to run it you have to leave the curtains wide open - so the room is as bright as Times Square. Shorter curtains would fix this issue, but some genius installed full length. But overall, it is a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is the difference”
Reviews.Author: DPennington
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel. The rooms are a little dated and cramped but the staff more than make up for it. Rooms were extremely clean and staff are exceptional. Two thumbs up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Boutique" hotel can be slang”
Reviews.Author: Beaverchamp
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a boutique hotel. Small rooms, but upgraded. There are tons of them in the city, but this one stands apart. First the staff is mostly amazing. There was one bellboy that was grumpy, but it was pouring rain so I am sure he was not happy. EVERYONE else was a dream. We stayed two nights, so we got to scope things out. The decor is art deco and fun. The street sounds were surprisingly quiet. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Galleria Park, a Joie de Vivre hotel”
Reviews.Author: denise r
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quaint. Not too large, elevator was always available. Free wine hour every night. The room was great with TV and great housekeeping staff. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. I can't say enough about the entire team. The guest registration staff were awesome. They were very helpful especially when I have never been stayed in that part of the city. They were knowledgeable and had customer service as a top priority. I would have hired any of them to take back to my place of employment. Maybe they had the Disney training but they were just awesome. They remembered my name for all 4 days of my stay. The bellboys/bellhops were awesome getting taxis, directions, and eating tips. Can't say enough good things about the hotel and staff. I will only stay there when I come back to the city. The hotel should have a 4 star rating on Travelocity not a 3 and 1/2 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like nice bathrooms?”
Reviews.Author: SKim78
Reviews.Content: Then this isn't the place for you. But other than the less-than-perfect bathrooms the rest of the hotel is lovely. The good: Great location for business or pleasure Great wine reception in evening and coffee in morning Staff is superb Beds are comfy The bad: Just one bad but as someone who likes a nice bathroom this one is a deal breaker for me. The bathroom in my room was just a small dingy shower stall and toilet and the sink was in the bedroom area. In my colleague's room she had a proper 4 piece bath but the bath is in dire need of replacing or at least a recaulking and her bedroom area was a much tighter space than mine.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: christudor
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of SF with excellent decor and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheChavelas
Reviews.Content: The GP is a hidden gem in the heart of San Francisco's financial and tourist districts. I am a native of the area and appreciate all that this hotel offers, which is quintessential San Francisco. The service here is provided by the best staff around, who will greet you by name and a legitimate friendliness you won't find anywhere else. I love this place and just keep coming back. I post this recommendation with only one concern: the GP gets so popular that they won't have a room available for me.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: regdawn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel not expecting much, but to our surprise was amazed. From the very second I walked in the door I was impressed with the extremely friendly staff. The room was very nicely furnished and had a great feel, it is close to all major transport and tourist activities. You must talk to Joel on the front desk for tips on things to do in the city he is just fantastic and will bring a smile to your face he couldn't be any friendly as were all the staff Zac at the concierge has great dining options. You must have breakfast at Sears on Powell St just a short walk away and you must ride a bike over the Golden Gate Bridge. The staff at The Galleria Park were much better than the Bellagio in Las Vegas which was a total let down after our stay at the Galleria Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AussieKC03
Reviews.Content: Sleep Quality: Beds were comfortable with good pillows. Given the city centre location, room was mostly quiet from street noise. Bathroom: Functional, with shower over bath. Good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Plenty of clean towels supplied. Food: Complimentary wine and cheese tasting in the lobby was great. Location: Good location within easy walking distance from BART station. Easy 10mins walk to the Port of San Francisco. Near to So-Ho and the financial district. Service: accommodating staff on reception. Value for money: A double room with 2 queen beds was Â£200 per night. Compared to other places Iâ€™ve stayed at around the world, this was very expensive however seemed good value for money when compared to similar properties in San Francisco. Other: Good, clean hotel and would recommend for a stay in San Fran. Free wi-fi in room.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbird112
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Francisco for me and my husband, we stayed 4 nights in Oct to celebrate our anniversary. We were interests in sight seeing and a few nice meals, and this location seemed to be pretty centrally located. I chose Galleria Park Hotel mainly from the reviews here on Tripadvisor and the good rate I got on Bookit.com. and happily I can say we were never disappointed at this property. The entire staff gave this intimate little hotel a warm and welcoming feel each time we returned from our adventures in this fabulous city. They were always smiling and ready to offer restaurant recommendations, hold a door, give directions or pour a delicious glass of California wine in the late afternoon, such a nice touch. Our room (727) was small but in an older building this is to be expected, we've actually stayed in smaller rooms in NYC. Size can be overlooked in our opinion if the room is clean and the beds are comfy. Which was the case at the Galleria Park, we had two full size beds with very fresh linens. Our bathroom was spotless, I had no reservations about actually soaking in the large tub, after two days of constant walking (crazy hills ya know). Our room had a large flat screen TV. There was a little street noise one morning but for the most part our room was nice and quiet. Coffee is complimentary each morning, and very tasty. We ate breakfast each morning just two doors down from the hotel at a little place called Fountain Cafe in the Galleria Mall, it was yummy and so reasonably priced. Just ask about it, at the front desk. So, if we are ever fortunate enough to visit San Francisco again, we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if I can get the same great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: tiggywiggy210
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Galleria Park for three nights in September 2011. The hotel was excellent - the staff (from front desk, to bellman, to cleaning staff) was professional and greeted me everytime I saw them. The rooms were modern and well-made up, and check-in/check-out was quick and painless.

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park Hotel - a piece of quiet in the fuss”
Reviews.Author: Idan H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Galleria Park Hotel for 4 nights during October of 2011. I had a GREAT time there for several reasons: The rooms - the rooms are very clean, fairly large and the beds are very comfortable. The amenities in the bathroom are superb, and the bathroom itself is very good and clean. The location - the location is very good. You go down to the street, and you see plenty of restaurants, bars and other places to hang out. The Union Square is just 3 minutes walk, as well as other tourist attractions and transportation (Muni, Bart etc.) The Staff - This hotel probably has the best staff I have personally seen in my entire trip.
