Reviews.Title: “Disappointing since I love the Joie de Vivre Hotels normally”
Reviews.Author: Lagreenwell
Reviews.Content: The fact that they say they have a fitness center is a joke. It's a couple machines in a cramped stinky room that was not built to be a gym (not ventilated correctly), which whatever, that's common. What made me mad was the hours-7am-9pm. Those are working hours! This hotel is near the financial district, how silly to assume we aren't up before that, and after that. Everyone broke the rules, but even if you'd sneak down at 6am, the gym was already packed because it is too small for the amount of rooms. The room was also cramped, not set up the most logically with walkways tight to cross the room. The bathroom had no space to put hairspray, face wash, etc up. I understand small space, but it just wasn't set up with usable shelves or anything, poor design and planning, just not a very feng shui area, I did not feel relaxed squeezing through and storing my stuff on the floor for a week. My co-worker told me her street facing room was horribly loud and she didn't sleep all week. The staff was gracious, wine hour was nice as always, but their facilities could use a good revamp, it just wasn't logical.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Galleria Park”
Reviews.Author: CityRebel
Reviews.Content: I used to study in San Francisco and whenever my parents came to visit they stayed at the Galleria Park and loved it. The location is perfect as it is very central and you can easily access all major transportation (MUNI, BART, Cable Car, buses) and you could also walk to many places like china town, union square, embarcardero etc. The only thing is that there were three of us, so we opted to use the pullout couch, which sadly was a bit old and uncomfortable, so updating those would be a good idea, but the beds are perfectly fine and the rooms in general are very cosy and neatly decorated. As to the street noise... staying in central San Francisco you will always have to deal with some level of street noise at any hotel, whereby the Galleria Park is pretty quiet as it is in the financial district, so evenings and weekends are not as busy as other areas of central SF. Overall I love this hotel, I highly recommend it and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: charleneshouse
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It was really comfy, stylish & in a great neighborhood for exploring San Francisco! p.s. I want to buy their pillows!!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved your hotel..can't wait till we go back..the best pet friendly hotel..thank you!”
Reviews.Author: nghepler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best pet friendly hotel I've ever stayed in.Your hotel is my new favorite place in SFO!..your whole entire staff was so friendly.We're eager to return to your wonderful city!..again thank you for making our stay so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “We could live here”
Reviews.Author: pokeycip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It's beautifully decorated. I wish their decorator could do my house. The staff is always gracious. The location is close to so much in San Francisco and very close to Union Square, but because it's a little closer to the Financial District it's a little less touristy. It's a great value for the area. They have a fireplace in the foyer where they serve wine in the evenings, and they have a garden area with a walking track. I gave it a 4 for sleep quality because there was a bit of street noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: 13amanda_gr
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the hotel the staff were welcoming. We arrived in the evening after a long day of driving, after check in we were offered a complimentary glass of wine. The room was spotless and comfortable, had great artwork, a comfortable bed and a bathroom I would like to replicate in my own home. The first morning of our stay one of the staff asked what my plan was for the day. I mentioned that the plan was general sightseeing, he then offered me 2 passes for a tour of the city that another guest only used for one of two days. The bus tour was perfect for my boyfriend and I, it was so nice of the previous guest to leave it for another guest to enjoy. I will definitely plan to stay at this hotel again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with personal service.”
Reviews.Author: mstevens616
Reviews.Content: When traveling in large cities, I tend to find the large conference (chain) hotels even at the conference rate are well over $200-$250/night so I look for smaller, boutique hotels that are less expensive. I found this hotel through kayak.com and was happy with the results. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Although I only was able to enjoy it once, the evening wine reception was a nice touch. I appreciate the free wireless internet (which is often $15/day in larger hotels). It was close to shopping and to the Embarcerdero Center where my meetings were. The only downside to this site was one night I was awoken by what sounded like a garabage truck and some construction at 3 in the morning, but I know that this was beyond the control of the hotel and is something that I could have encountered at any hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Up All Night”
Reviews.Author: audraandiris
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that has been nicely re-appointed, however, it's age shows through. The decor looks decent, but the paint was peeling off in my room. There was a poorly-insulated window-unit air conditioner in the room which made for a noisy night. It sounded like I was sleeping (trying to sleep) right on the street. The beds are small. I'm 5'5" and my feet hung off the end just a tad. The beds are also super springy and gave me a terrible backache. The staff was courteous. I was charged $1 for "Asian Women's Resource Center - Donation." What? No one asked me to make any donation. I call that stealing. The credit card machine conveniently did not work when I was checking out (perhaps part of the donation scheme?). Don't go past the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: renatoma
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, courteous & pleasant employees, clean & quite rooms. They also serve free wine late afternoon. We surely will go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for my trip”
Reviews.Author: centra3k
Reviews.Content: I was visiting a nearby firm and this place was literally 2 minutes away by foot, which is why it was chosen. It's also very close to a BART station. Beds are comfortable, staff is helpful. You might want to ask for a room that is not facing Sutter; it was noisy the night I was there. Free coffee in the morning, quick check-out, no stress. Pretty much all that I wanted!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for city sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: mattnerja
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff who could not do enough to satisfy your stay in the Galleria Park Hotel. Not a pretty view from our inside room but we only iused the room for sleeping and preferred the inner side to avoid street noise. Nice to have a shower robe to use. Loved the complimentary wine hour each evening. Very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice and Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetBlue777
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, the location was close to Chinatown, shops, restaurants and other attractions. The staff - they were okay, a bit classy and not very cheery or friendly, but still good. The rooms were excellent, it was unique in its own way - the bathroom was well stocked and the hotel itself has this really cozy feel. The fireplace was an added bonus, we stayed at the lobby for some times because our flight arrived at 7AM, but they checked us in early instead of 3PM. Overall, a nice hotel with a good price. Stayed their for two nights . The hotel was cozy, trendy and modern, would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdog16
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. The staff were super friendly and very helpful. We received a complimentary upgrade to a king room and the bed was so comfortable. The hotel was in a good location- found it to be quiet and out of the way however was still in walking distance to shopping and restaurants. The business centre offers free internet (you get 20 minutes every 24 hours) which was handy because I didn't have my own laptop. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid budget hotel for a casual weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: juliagulia24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after being in Palo Alto for business & wanted to extend my trip to visit some friends & had my pal from LA join me. Good find! I got a deal on Travelzoo for ~$125/night and it was perfect. Likes: Right in the middle of the city, so it was not more than walk or a short $10/15 cab ride away form anything I went to (mainly the Mission & Russian Hill). It had enough amenities of a hotel - someone to hail/call cabs for you, store luggage, room service (we got someone to bring us a spoon at 2:30AM to eat leftovers!) - but cost the same as a B&B or cheap chain hotel. AND they had free wine for 2 or 3 hours every evening! Dislikes: It was tough to get a cab on Friday at like 8PM because it's a financial area that dies down at night. It also is clearly a work in progress - The lobby was lovely, but you can tell it is slowly being renovated from a previously crummy state, but it's getting there! This is truly boutique-y, though - Small rooms, not ubber polished looking or staffed, but I would def. recommend if the price was similar for someone else. Retort to haters: Staff was nice & helpful to me &, though I did request a quiet room, I can't imagine it would be noisy ever since it's in a dead area nightlife wise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful hosts, lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: delanor
Reviews.Content: We wish everyone ran a hotel this well! Very friendly, helpful staff, comfortable lobby with complementary wine in the evening and a fireplace; delicious free coffee in the AM. We stayed for 3 nights then left to stay with friends for a few days, but when the east coast got snowed under, we ended up having to stay in SF for 4 more days (big problem eh?) and liked this place so much we came right back. When we checked back in, the valet remembered us and sent up cocoa and biscotti to our room as a hello. Wow. Walking distance to great restaurants, transportation, easy valet parking. Rooms were smallish but bed was quite comfy, free wifi, a staff that genuinely wants you to enjoy your stay. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, basic hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: rmox
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip, and was kept so busy with meetings that I didn't take full advantage of the fun extras associated with this hotel - namely the complementary wine hour each evening, or the rooftop terrace/sitting area. However, the hotel was very comfortable and was decorated beautifully. You can tell that it is an old building, but all amenities are modern. Quite frankly, the glimpes of age within the building are charming. Small room but pretty and comfortable. Friendly staff. Hotel is in an excellent location for both business and pleasure and is a nice change from the more sterile, large hotel chains like Hyatt/Hilton/Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “central, friendly, clean - in short: VERY recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: fedtmule99
Reviews.Content: Spending Xmas with friends in Berkeley on the other side of the East Bay, but having decided against having to sleep on a couch because the house was so full of visitors, I chose this small hotel because of the central location, only one block from Montgomery St. BART and previous ratings, and I must say, I was not disappointed at all. Staff was very friendly, room was not large, but clean and cleaned daily. I had called inadvanced and asked for a roon away from the street, a whish that was granted immediately. I never used their daily offer of wine tasting but frequently upon returning from somewhere saw loads of people sitting around the cozy reception area with wine glasses. My overall impression is a very nice and friendly, albeit small hotel, centrally located - will surely use again !

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLeslie
Reviews.Content: After a short walk from the Montgomery Street BART station, we entered a lovely boutique hotel. We purchased our stay from Priceline, but I had called the day before to request a king bed. It was available when we arrived at no extra cost. The room was small, but very nice. The hotel is near Union Square and great for shopping and restaurants. The room was very quiet and the bathroom had everything.

Reviews.Title: “Promised much, delivered very little”
Reviews.Author: mountainwineryfan
Reviews.Content: We had a pre-paid Priceline reservation. When we arrived, we were told the hotel was all booked. We were to be sent to a "sister hotel" two miles away for one night. I responded that we didn't wish to be moved after one night. I was told the hotel would only pay for one night at the other hotel. I threw a tantrum & they agreed to pay for two nights. I know screw-ups can happen, but this one was handled badly by staff. Very unpleasant experience, & we were stuck a couple of miles from downtown. The second hotel (Hotel Tomo) was pleasant enough, but definitely not the downtown location we sought. On the second evening, I got a call from the Galleria Park manager apologizing. She then spontaneously offered to return our Priceline payment. That would have made me feel better, if it had happened -- but three weeks later I am still waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in all of San Francisco!!!”
Reviews.Author: dbottjer32706
Reviews.Content: The Galleria Park is truly one of the best hotels in San Francisco! The location is perfecct. Once they park our car, we don't have to see it again until we leave. The hotel is conveniently located between the financial district and Union Square so you can walk everywhere! We've even walked to the Ferry Building - a mere 15 minute walk away. You will find the staff welcoming and extremely knowledgeable about the restaurants and other SF sites. We absolutely love this hotel! The rooms are beautifully appointed and the 5:30 p.m. wine hour is very, very nice! We have met some wonderful people while sipping on good CA white wine. You won't be disappointed if you book a room at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: mozgal
Reviews.Content: We called the Galleria Park Hotel home this past weekend for my birthday -- what a joy! The hotel decor/ambiance is lovely, and our room was charming and much bigger than expected. Also, when the hotel staff learned it was my birthday, they sent wine/tulips/chocolates up to my room to celebrate -- what a touch of class! We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, basic, no frills”
Reviews.Author: mfioreboston
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough boutique hotel not far from Union Square. My room was an interior room and was very quiet. The overhead lighting is stark and unwelcoming, but if you use the lamps, it's a much homier feel. The windows open, which is a nice touch. My room was small, but clean and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable with surprisingly soft sheets. It's a great value, the front desk staff is very helpful and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: harinreddy
Reviews.Content: Me and my senor collegue from India stayed here and participated in AIChE symposium in the city. Room service was prompt and good. Morning coffee and evening wine festival were fine . Hope it is decent hotel for a short stay and economical . Room was nice and compact enough for twin sharing.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale, cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: podunk_poppers
Reviews.Content: The Galleria Park was surpringly perfect for a recent getaway to SF. The rooms are on the small side, but that seems standard in SF. I loved the decor, and although the rooms seemed a tad worn, everything was clean and comfy. We were on the 2nd floor, street side, and weren't bothered by any street noise. I would recommend this hotel to anyone... we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tancred32
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was nice & clean and the location was good - not right in the heart of it all but only a short walk away from it. We found the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL, AWFUL, AWFUL!! It's Dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: kpm713
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump! I'm really shocked that it's considered a 3 star hotel, more like -5 stars. It smells, the rooms are the size of a college dorm, the tv is from the 90's and they boast of room service and even have a door tag for breakfast. Oh but wait, room service doesn't start until 7:00, so for people who have to work it's so convenient- NOT. The icing on the cake, a window unit for an air conditioner that sounds like a mack truck idling. When I first arrived, the service was poor. I'm waiting to check in while the front desk clerk was chatting it up on the phone (personal call). Clearly customer service is NOT their business model. It's supposed to be a boutique hotel but it looks like one of the pay by the hour types you'd think you would only see in movies. There's not enough space or time for me to describe the bathroom. Pack a pair of shower shoes, extra bed linen and house slippers. This business trip has been so far DREADFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off by the name”
Reviews.Author: Bridboy
Reviews.Content: Third stay in SF but first stay at this hotel. I was initially wary of the poncey name and its description as a "boutique" hotel owned by a group with the name "Joie de Vivre". It all sounded a bit camp. However, my granddaughter lives in SF and visited the hotel on an architectural tour and assured me it was fine. She was right. This hotel is very well located in the financial district. You can easily walk to the tourist parts of the city and the BART railway system is very close by (handy to know when you are dragging your bags to and from the airport). The room I had on the seventh floor was spacious and well equipped. The front desk staff were unfaillingly polite and helpful. The special factor of this hotel is the wine tasting every evening for an hour. Guests get together in the lobby and just enjoy some glasses of wine together. This creates a friendly atmosphere in which guesrs open up and share their experiences of the city. Better than a guide book! Also an excellent start to a good evening out. So dont be put off by the name. Just go for it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault it, Ideal Location to explore and feel safe, Adam (Burnley Lancs)”
Reviews.Author: Adam041971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the galleria park, i was dubious prior as I did not know what to expect. However the price was reasonable, the hotel nice and clean and the rooms although not big, are very clean with nice decor. The location is the best though, altough there is a lot of walking to be done in SF the location of this place is superb, we really dont think we could have picked better. SF, although there are a few odd people around, there is no threatening atmosphere, i lovely place, my only regret is that we only had three days. ALCATRAZ IS A MUST THO!! book on line before you go to avoid disapointment

Reviews.Title: “A boutique place without the boutique worries”
Reviews.Author: DiscoBeavers
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on October 8th for one night while passing throught SF. Arrived at 8am and they checked us right in - which was a huge plus and a relief. I used hotwire for 2 adults, but hotwire put us in a room with a double bed "which frequently happens with hotwire" according to the staff. No worries as we were upgraded to king bed at no extra charge. Room was sized right for a boutique place - just what you would expect (odd angles, etc). Did the bed bug check and it passed. The place had free wine and we certainly got our moneys worth; made new friends from Virginia, Orange County, and Sacramento - thanks wine! Happy hour at the Midi lounge was great - trendy joint. Staff was very helpful with checkin, checkout, valet droppoff and retrieve. Would stay here again for sure. Paid $160 on a Friday night + tax + $35 for valet. Hotwire rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at an even better price”
Reviews.Author: Poptart007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-September for 4 nights. This was a great find. We arrived on a Saturday night and received a warm welcome from the guy on the reception desk (Grant - I think) who made sure that we had everything we needed to survive our first night in San Francsico! He told us all about the free wine every evening in the foyer - a great chance for solo travellers to mingle. The room was spotless and there were courtesy cards in there informing us how the laundry worked. They made sure that our towels and toiletries were always in full supply. There was a business centre and gym there for our use. Free wi-fi, a good selection of tv channels and comfy beds all put a smile on our faces. The hotels location is great, near Union Sq and China Town in the heart of the Financial District and within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, the Modern Art Museum and plenty of other attractions. Most of the staff here were nice and accomodating when we had questions and I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends who are looking for a good value, centrally located hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hokiecuz
Reviews.Content: the hotel location was great and the service at the front desk was excellent. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are relatively small but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in centre of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Niki84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September. Location is great, we were able to walk everywhere. We stayed in an inner courtyard room on the 7th floor, and it was super quiet. We heard no noise from outside or from other rooms. Hotel was very clean, with a comfy king size bed and a powerful shower. Staff were all really helpful, and the town car to the airport was great and not much more than a cab. Would stay here again if we travel back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 5 nights to attend a...”
Reviews.Author: lovestotraveltoomuch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights to attend a conference. I enjoyed my stay last year so much that I didn't think twice about staying here again. The hotel is in a great location. It is a very short walk to Market Street and all of the shopping. The F line train stop was right across the street when you got onto market street. There was a bus stop around the corner of the hotel also. My room faced the interior so it was less noisy. Last year I had a room that faced out towards Sutter and it was noisy in the early morning. The room was neat and clean and I slept very well. I would recommend staying here if traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: janellb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from a Thursday-Sunday. The hotel service was amazing. My husband was able to check in 3 hours early. They gave us a street side room which was a little noisy so we asked if we could have a courtyard and was meet by the staff within 5 mins to move our stuff to another room. We asked if we could have late checkout and they said to stay as long as we needed. The rooms are a little small but the decor is so adorable and really plays off the 'age' of the hotel. The location was great. The little bar/restaurant was great. The happy hour with free vine was great. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible noise until 2AM from contruction across the street”
Reviews.Author: JoeinMB
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel and have conducted several business meetings here and personal stays over the years. I brought my wife here on one of our first dates over twenty years ago. So when we were able to get away for the weekend away from the now teenage kids I did not hesitate to make a reservation here. There was no mention of the on going construction across the street by the helpful reservations agent. When we checked in yesterday, again, no mention by the clerk and no letter from the manager about the loud construction site across the street (a mere 15 paces away.) We were assigned a room directly across from the construction site- it's mostly a major renovation. We had a lovely dinner at Scala's Bistro and revisited the lovely Starlight Room at the top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel. When we were walking back to the Galleria Park at 10PM we heard a lot of noise coming from the construction site. When we entered the hotel we asked the clerk if the noise was going to go on all night. No, we were assured. We watched a little TV and had to crank up the volume to mask the noise. Went to sleep at 10:30PM. Was awoken the first time at midnight by loud crashing- turned out to be huge chunks of concrete being tossed down metal chutes to a dump truck. Called the desk again. Yes, I was told, the noise is bothersome but it will end at midnight. It did not. Awoken again at 1:15AM. Oh, the clerk said, the permit allowed them to work until 3AM!!! but the manager had asked them to stop work at midnight. I was offered ear plugs. I left a voice mail for the manager which, I am sure, recorded the loud noises from across the street. A sleepness night capped by the constant drone of diesel truck parked across the street at 5AM with the engine running. I dressed and went to the lobby since I could not sleep. I asked the clerk to check on the truck and call the police to have it at least turn off its engine. He first said there was nothing he could do. At my further prompting he said he would check on it. He came back and promptly called the police. Based upon the lack of advance notice by reservations and no notification by the manager I would have to say that this borders on fraud and I would not recommend staying at the Galleria Park or any of the Joie de vivre properties. It was certainly not a professional way to treat guests and potential guests. There are lots of choices to stay in downtown San Francisco and I only wish I was afforded the opportunity to make a more informed choice. This was a rare beautiful clear and warm day in San Francisco! We are off to the Healdsburg for, hopefully, some well deserved R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: StuAndCel
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff friendly, check in quick & easy, door staff always attentive. Room reasonable size, bigger than you would expect reading some of the reviews on here, plenty big enough for 2 people and 2 bags. A little bit dark, but this was due to it being an inner 'Courtyard' room. This meaning we didnt have any issues with street noise, we did however have the noisiest Air Conditioning Unit in the world, sounded like a bag of nails every time it started up! Location was great, close to Union Square, Market Street, Chinatown etc. Easy transport to airport or fishermans wharf nearby. Also got to say the Bread & Cocoa Coffee House next door is the best anywhere, amazing coffee!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: richie_63
Reviews.Content: family of 4 with 2 teenage girls stayed in august 2010 for 5 nights. hotel near Montgomery BART so easy to get to and from airport. one of the reasons we picked it. Near shopping area of union square. bit of a walk to north san fran pier 39 etc. room was quite small for a family of 4 with teenage girls. on floor 3 overlooking vermehr place. sleep was interrupted every night due to trash collection at 4 a.m. plus some vagrants looking through bins. room and hotel was very clean. free coffee every morning - which could be collected outside of first floor restaurant. didn't try food at hotel so can't comment however the restaurant looked very nice, good location for south of city - easy access to open top bus tour (to golden gate etc.) also easy for china town, shops. I would stay here again but would need a bigger room for 4.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location, small/old”
Reviews.Author: careerdagger
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location--worth it just for that. The rooms are very small and the hotel itself is quite old. I was surprised after reading that it was recently renovated, to see outdated television sets and an old dresser in the room, plus peeling paint in the bathroom. The shower stall was the smallest I have ever seen-seriously you could barely turn around. All in all, we only paid $130 a night and since we were sight-seeing it was just fine. The location was central to almost everything--except at night it was a bit deserted. The financial district clears out. Also, not much is open in the area in the early morning either. Oh, and the coffee in the morning was actually great--avoid the coffee from the market/coffee shop on the corner - burning hot and tasted terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: ky776
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place to stay but the rooms are very small and somewhat cramped. I would recommend for business travelers and couples but not anyone with children. The staff is very nice and the rooms are kept clean. The location is centralized and a good jumping off point in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: marsriggs
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Nice location. Loved the evening wine hour. Our room was a bit small but it was on the interior so noise was not an issue. The bathroom paint was peeling a bit but again not a big deal. Although they have free in room wifi if you use the computer at the business center you pay for usage over 20 mins and everything you print. Rather cheesy for the vibe of hotel, especially since so many people need to check in for flights online and print boarding passes. Parking was valet only $35 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforpleasure
Reviews.Content: Recommended for a great location and every facility needed, close to Union Square with easting/coffeee places nearby. Helpful friendly staff and assistance with luggage was appreciated. Would not hesitate to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: fl0wzah
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, clean rooms, wireless internet working, central location. If you book your room early enough, you even get a great rate. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best....”
Reviews.Author: MoopyMooMoo
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited about staying at this hotel as it looks fantastic on the website. The room was ok, small but clean, the bathroom however was mouldy with cracked tiles and my bed sheet and pillow had holes in it. I found the reception staff very short and rude and quite un helpful, we said we didnt want the $35 dollar a night valet parking although they tried to charge us for three nights worth on checkout. We also charged almost $70 dollars for a 5 minute call to LA (crazy) be warned. We were kept awake all night by a drilling putside our window, when asked about our stay we were just told 'everyone has complained about that' we also commented that our stay wasn't great but nothing was said. I f you want to feel welcome at a hotel don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever! Paid boutique prices for mid-level hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LA-DCguy
Reviews.Content: We have been very happy at Joie de Vivre hotels in SF and could not have been more dissapointed by this experience. We had trouble from the start--rude front desk staff, bellmen who never even attempted to help with baggage, problems with the bill and double charging our credit card, mishandled arrangments with the airport pick-up, and a very sub-standard room for a steep price (nearly $400/night). We ultimately got an upgrade since we were paying too much for such a small room (and are members of JdV), but the damage was done by the rude front desk service and general incompetence. A good thing: The housekeepers are nice. The hotel doesn't offer the services that a hotel charging these prices should have--for example, they have limited room service (none on weekend mornings), no concierge , terrible "gym", etc. Do yourself a favor and stay someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - excellent location and wine hour!”
Reviews.Author: L_traveller101
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel using expedia and were very very happy with our stay. We stayed for 3 nights on a tour around California. The location is excellent and the staff on front desk were very helpful at giving advice on where to eat/what to see. The room was very nice (if a bit small - only a very small criticism) and the wine hour is a nice touch. Would love to stop again for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: AudgeSanAntonioTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on business. I would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. First.....they start the evening with samples of wine. (All Complimentary)... Second.....Valet park your car with *Free*parking (I stayed at the Opal on Van Ness and paid $25.00 per night parking and had to struggle to get help opening the gate) Third.....Very clean, very nice...and helpful staff. I really couldn't get over how customer focused they were.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and good location..”
Reviews.Author: Tene75
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel indeed.. good location about 10 minutes walk to Union Square. We had our room on the top floor so the room was quiet as well. We will definately come back to this hotel our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: ModernTraveler10
Reviews.Content: went to SF for 4th of July weekend. stay at the Galleria for 2 nights. great stay. well located property. smaller room but well designed, appointed and very comfortable. highly suggest it to someone that is looking for something nice, hip and cool but still very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to start a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: rjmccurdy1011
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to San Francisco so I didn't know what was in store for us. It was the kickoff stay to our elopement and honeymoon and we wanted something centrally located in the city for our first three days so we could really experience the city. The location was perfect for what we wanted. We could walk to Chinatown and Union Square and was only a couple of blocks from Market street and the cable car lines. It was also a short cab ride to the restaurants in North Beach and city hall where we had to get our marriage license. With two of our three days spent over the weekend, the Financial District was a good place to land because it was relatively quiet and cheap. The rates went up on Monday when business picked up around the hotel. The hotel is old, but renovated well with all the modern conveniences. We loved the lobby and the way it was decorated, plus enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting in the evening. We got upgraded to a suite which was a nice touch from the staff. The bathroom was small, but the TV room was nice because it was separate from the bedroom. The bedroom also had a TV, and the bed was certainly roomy and comfortable if a tad firm. The restaurant which was part of the hotel featured a really good breakfast. I recommend the french toast. The staff was super friendly and helpful especially since we were tourists with no real San Fran experience. They pointed us in the right direction each time and no question was too silly. If there was one complaint, it was that the rooms could get pretty noisy with the street traffic, so if you're a light sleeper, it could be a bit of a problem. I did all right and I can sometimes sleep lightly in new places, but it was noticeable. If we go back, we wouldn't hesitate staying here or one of the other many properties the owners have around the city.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Whofan70
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Galleria Park Hotel for 3 nights. I'm hard pressed to find any complaints worthy of mention; maybe just a few annoyances. Price: Paid my companies corporate rate which is lower than the advertised price so suffice to say that we got a great deal. Room: Room was very nice and clean and provided everything that we needed. My only issues are with the rooms facing Sutter Street tend to be noisy at night so our sleep suffered a bit so ask for an interior room. Location: PERFECT! Just a few blocks from Chinatown and Union Square. Even the walk down to the waterfront (Ferry Building for the farmers market) was easy. Service: Overall great service and they made us feel welcomed. My slight complaint was of one morning front desk attendant who was only as nice as she had to be. Otherwise, the concierge staff was GREAT! Overall: A wonderful boutique style hotel and in a perfect location. If you are tired of the "typical" hotels.....then give this one a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gersa
Reviews.Content: We arrived early after a 12 hour flight and was greeted with a smile and able to check in early. The room as we expected from other reviews small but very clean and what I thought was a large bathroom by New Zealand standards. This hotel is close to everything you need with the Bart & Streetcar just around the corner on Montgomery Street. The Free Wine Hour in the lobby is a great way to meet other guests. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOVENATLPARKS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at the Galleria Park in early June when we attended the Impressionist exhibition at the DeYoung Museum. Our room was very pleasant; I'd say that the hotel is one of the finer boutique hotels in which I have stayed near Union Square. The hotel was quite convenient to the Ferry Building where the AMTRAK bus brought us and later met us for our ride to the Emerville train station. The lack of Sunday room service is a disappointment as was the Midi restaurant's brunch. I would suggest other eating establishments for breakfast/brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingirl58
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and found it to be very clean and tidy and the bed and pillows were excellent. I find these the most important things when staying at any hotel. Staff were fine, I would say professional and polite. Didn't really speak to anyone other than at check in and check out. Enjoyed the complimentary tea and coffee each morning and wine each evening. The seats by the fire in the reception area were very cosy and welcoming as it was chilly some days. Free use of the internet for 20 minutes each day was also very beneficial. The location is excellent, near to shopping, F line, buses and the Bay area.Rather noisy area at night but it is a city after all, and we were there over the weekend when people were out late making merry. We found this hotel good value and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichelfromMontreal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at GP May 1-4 and after reviewing many hotels in the SF business center area. Primerly chose GP because we had one night free by booking on the Air Canada web site under the" Hotel only" section. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel mainly because it was close to many interesting places to visit in SF. They offer free cofee or tea in the morning and a complimentary glass of wine in the lobby in they afternoon starting at 5:30. We did not eat at their restaurant "MIDI" , we took a quick look at the menu and figured 25$ for breakfast was to pricy for us. There is a nice quiet outside terrace on the 3 rd floor where you can sit and relax, walk your dog or even smoke a cigarette. It is a non-smoking hotel, but that little hide out is very much appreciated by smokers as they dont have to leave the hotel and smoke by the front door like you see at other Hotel in the area. The rooms are on the small side, if you are more than 2 people you'd better ask for their bigger rooms (suite). Bathroom also is very small, but the bed was confortable. Finally, we saw somewhere on their website where they mention free transportation within a five miles radius. We asked 3 times during our stay if we could, on the day of our departure have a lift to the car rental garage neaby , each time a different man at the front desk would told us a different reason and that they could not help us. They told us to take a taxi. I think this service dos not really exist.

Reviews.Title: “was ok if you don't stay in your room”
Reviews.Author: MelissaEPower
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, its a pretty good deal. We had # 415 and the A/c was not working, so we got switched to #215. Its a pretty noisy part of town. All night I heard the metal from the trolley rail. Every time a car drove over the railing, it was obnoxious. The only thing offered is coffeetea in the morning for free and that was alright. Theres no pool or jacuzzi and the rooms were ok. Nothing great. I'm sure for the price, you can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: rubbiecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family event for about 40 people. Terrific location, staff was professional and accomodating. This is a smallish boutique hotel with full service - room service, valet parking, meeting rooms, bar & restaurant. Rooms were small but efficiently organized and well appointed. Our event was held in one of the conference rooms but it was set up beautifully for our needs. Buffet meal and servers were good. It made for a lovely event and for good memories. Parking fee is stiff - $35 for cars and $40 or more for oversized SUV's. Only small problem now is getting a copy of my bill for review. The printer was working slowly upon checkout and we had to leave without it. I've sent emails for 3 days now trying to get a copy. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, good experience!”
Reviews.Author: mnstn
Reviews.Content: First of all, Expedia gave us a wonderful deal for 5 nights at the hotel and round trip with United (IAD-SFO), so we had a great feeling about the whole trip to begin with. Being from the East Coast, this was our first stay at Joie de Vivre Hotel chain and overall we had a really good experience. The hotel has absolutely fantastic location: Walking distance to many attractions, bars, restaurants, shops, MUNI and Bart stops. The staff was really courteous and helpful about anything and everything. Our flight arrived in the morning and we were in our room freshening up 15 minutes after we walked into the hotel, we were definitely very thankful. We checked out their restaurant Midi for dinner (room service) and Sunday brunch. In both cases the food was good, the service was very prompt and staff was friendly. The room was a little too small for comfort and there was not much natural light coming in as we were facing one of the towers, but it was OK, especially since we did not spend too much time in the room (and the rooms overlooking the street can get really noisy). I really enjoyed their bathroom products. The hotel had free wireless internet, which is a rarity, however be aware that it can be slow to download attachments etc. and the strength of the connection can be very weak from time to time. Overall, our experience was really great and we will definitely look for the hotel chain when we are back in the region. Recommend for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “small room, but clean, great value, and unique style”
Reviews.Author: KTAK150
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel. The location is amazing-close to good shopping, attractions, and in a nice part of the downtown area. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well appointed. The price was great-but it was a pretty small room. There was three of us staying in it, and so it was pretty cozy. The attached restaurant lacked options- I would suggest going out because there is so much more nearby. One major downfall though, every morning at about 5 am we heard the garbage truck or city sweeper or something noisy outside. It is an old hotel, so not the most sound proof. The evening wine reception was awesome though! Really adorable lobby and fireplace.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sueyVictoria
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. They let us lock our bike in the secure underground parking garage. Sutter Street gave us a great flat home base to begin our bicycle rides. Close enough to walk to SOMA, North Beach, Waterfront, Chinatown, big shopping stores. Next door was a coffee shop with great espresso and oatmeal breakfast. Across the street, was inexpensive juice bar. The lobby was relaxed and played electro lounge music. Free wine hour every night. Mainly younger clientele. Mellow , easy going place.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but shame about the corrupt doormen”
Reviews.Author: TrxterW11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. I stayed for 6 nights, and while the "Deluxe King" room was small (edge around the bed end), it ticked all the boxes for a business class hotel - clean, friendly staff, free wifi etc. I was surprised they don't serve breakfast at weekends, which was annoying but did send me off to Dottie's for a brilliant pancake or three. I'd give the hotel restaurant a miss. That was one dry, bog standard burger. The bizarre thing about this hotel (and many other SF ones apparently) is the fact that the doormen operate a con. Ask them to order you a taxi, and they call their favourite cab company. When the cabbie arrives, he asks you whether it's cash or credit card. If you say the former, the cabbie has to pay the doorman $10 and if it's CC, they pay $5. I saw the "transaction" - the cabbie passed the bill to the doorman who palmed it. Now that HAS to be illegal. I asked him why he paid the doorman and he said that if he didn't pay, he would not get the call from the switchboard putting him on the fare. He said that the doormen have an agreement to share what they take from the cabbies with the cab company switchboard operator. My cabbie told me that this is the way it works in San Francisco. If you complain, you get no fares. And no-one will snitch for obvious reasons. RICO... So, a standard hotel if you can ignore the corruption on the door.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up for Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights recently. Best thing was the comfortable bed! We had an inside (away from street) room which was very quiet at night. Place is well decorated, but here and there in our room was some chipped paint, but is expected for an older building. All amenities we needed were here, so would recommend. Only 2 blocks from BART, easy 30 minute ride to SFO.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Union Square - Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JandKQLD
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay. It's about 1 block from the BART system from the airport, 2 blocks from Union Square and a close walk to other shopping and eating places. We were upgraded on arrival to a junior suite and it was nice. The rooms aren't very large but with everything to do in San Francisco, you aren't in the room very much. Complementary Wi-Fi, a happy hour and complementary coffee and tea every morning completes this hotel as a great place to stay at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but small, with good design”
Reviews.Author: TeamRandR
Reviews.Content: So far this is our favorite Joie de Vivre in the Union Square / Financial district. The lobby is very welcoming with comfy chairs and a fireplace. Ask for an exterior room unless you donâ€™t mind looking into a smallish interior courtyard. Mr. R probably doesnâ€™t care much about it, but I like pale blues and greens that break up the nice, bright white walls. A good paint job goes a long way, but cannot possibly mask the fact that this is a very old building. Beds are comfortable and the work area is sufficient although the internet was unreliable and unusably slow. Nothing notable in the bathroom, which given the age of the building is a good thing! Many restaurants are within a few blocks so we havenâ€™t yet tried the hotelâ€™s own eatery which is often too noisy for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SETHDEHART
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed at the Galleria before and I was very happy. I travel regularly for work and this was my first JDV Hotel experience. Everyone was very friendly and the rooms were clean. Unfortunately I didn't have a chance to check out the bar/restaurant, but they had teh Olympics on a screen and it looked like a lot of people were having fun. I would definitely stay this hotel and my only complaint is that I couldn't stay longer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: stringman25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a 3 night stay at the Galleria Park. It is in a great location just 2 blocks above Union Square and 3 blocks from Powell St. Convenient to cable cars, restaurants, and shopping. The entrance to Chinatown was also a short 2 block walk. It is a smaller hotel, only a few stories. Rooms were very nice and decorated in a typical "boutique" style. Some people might think the rooms are small but we've stayed many places in San Francisco and thought they were similar in size. Rooms tend to be more European in size here. The staff was extremely friendly...everyone said hi when you walked through the lobby and the bellman opened the door each time in and out if he wasn't assisting another customer. They hold a complimentary wine reception in the lobby from 530p to 630p each night. We found it nice to have a couple glasses before we headed out for the evening. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Over 25 stays per year... & I love the place!”
Reviews.Author: EFW333
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler I have made the Galleria Park Hotel my #1 lodging choice in San Francisco for over 5 years. I'm a clinically diagnosed high maintenance guest so it gives me pleasure to give Galleria Park my rare & unconditional praise. I don't think you'll find a more professional and friendly staff in SF. Sure you may hear street noise but that's typical in any major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: CompulsiveReviewer
Reviews.Content: The plus points: + excellent location; really the best in San Francisco. Walking distance to China Town and Union Square and 2 mins walk from all public transport links. No car needed. + room decor is nice - contemporary. + complimentary wine 5:30-6:30pm daily. The negative points: - superficially the hotel is fine but you will soon be frustrated as nothing works (the heater doesn't work, the hairdryer cuts out every 2 mins, the remote control battery is flaky, the safe doesn't lock, the towels have holes in them) - the service at the front deks is poor - staff do not know the city well and frequently sent us to the wrong location. In summary, the location merits the price but you should look to pay no more than $90 per night to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!!”
Reviews.Author: fatebeliever
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what my husband and I were looking for on our first trip to San Fran! It is located two blocks from the center of union square, and china town, and with-in walking distance to little Italy! The staff was always friendly, internet access came in handy with our laptop, and Jacob, at the bell desk, was extremely helpful with our tour to Napa Valley and other activities we had questions on. The wine hour from 5:30-6:30 was wonderful! Our only critique was that the bed was a little small, but we enjoyed the intimacy of the hotel and historic value of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: KBJuarez
Reviews.Content: After searching many hotel web sites, I chose Galleria Park. We did not want to stay at a large hotel, but appreciate the ammenities provided by them. This wonderful hotel provided them all. It is done very nicely in an Art Deco theme. The rooms are good sized & clean with updated bathrooms , adequate sized elevators, free internet, in room coffee and refrigerators, very personable staff, a workout room, an outdoor 3rd floor terrace where you can jog or walk the dog AND NO GARBAGE TRUCKS in the middle of the night. We were able to park our SUV in a garage 1/2 block away for $30/day( no in & out tho')

Reviews.Title: “Galleria Park yourself here!”
Reviews.Author: shez12
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Lovely boutique hotel with great rooms, beds and decor - super spacious (we got a corner room). Situated in the heart of the city with 24hr reception - i think remembering. Walking distance to the metro, uphill to chinatown and downhill to shopping district - pretty much in the middle! Though could hear a few street noises at night... but you should come home dead tired from the tours anyways to take notice. Also, there is a farmers market on one particular day of the week downstairs - great to see fresh produce! Free Wifi was a big plus! Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: chgotraveler1116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for the first time to San Francisco on an extended weekend getaway. We had such a great time. First, the hotel we stayed at, the Galleria Park Hotel, treated us very well. The staff was attentive to our needs and made the stay pleasurable. They also host a wine tasting in the early evening, which is a great way to relax after a day of sightseeing. We discovered several hidden gems such as a pizza place that delivered to our hotel room (pizza was fabulous!!) and a small wine bar a couple of blocks from the hotel which had a soothing, relaxing vibe. One of our best dining experiences was eating at one of the small stands selling seafood at the Wharf. We couldn't get enough of the fried crab sticks and clams. It is also worth taking the ferry to Sausalito and exploring. Another great experience. Overall, we would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: 4Luvmy2
Reviews.Content: This property is nicely located in the heart of San Francisco near shopping. It s nicely decoated as you would expect from a boutique property. The rooms are a little small but sufficient. A few problems. I had to move rooms because my original room was located on the inside of the hotel and I couldn't get any cell phone reception. My second room was on the outside, but was on the street side, so I had to tolerate the street noise while I attempted to sleep. There's not much shelving in the bathroom for women to put their cosmetics. There's no control in the room for heat. The "gym" is a joke. It's a little room with 1 treadmill, 1 elliptical, 1 bike and some weights. There's not towels or anyting to wipe down the sweaty equipment. The breakfast omelet that I got both days was not good. Including the sausage and OJ. However, the mushroom soup for dinner was AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: CDillon
Reviews.Content: For location alone it is well worth it. Staff outstanding in helpfulness. Hotel is older but was very nicely kept. Rooms are small but who stays in a hotel room when you are in San Francisco anyways. Would recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all the way”
Reviews.Author: Joben180910
Reviews.Content: We went to S.F. from Sept. 25th, 2009 to October 2nd, 2009. Yes, the room the smallish, but the rest is incredible. You hear nothing from the street below, the bed is comfortable, the employees are super nice. A1 Wine tasting every afternoon from 5pm to 6h30 pm Try the Midi Restaurant, 10/10 Would go back tomorrow. Very central, we walked everywhere no need for bus passes. In the traways, please please please wait until the car has stopped. I was thrown off the traway by a big conductor who taught me a lesson. He was scary! Beautiful city, people are lucky to live there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff but not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: willdc1
Reviews.Content: I booked here for one night based on the reviews on tripadvisor at the time. The room was booked on a room only basis via hotels.com The location of the hotel is excellent - about a 5 minute walk from Union Square. Check-in was simple and the reception area was quite glamorous with a fire and plush seating. Good start! The staff were really frienly and helpful when we asked about how to get to particular places. We took the lift to our room on the second floor and this is where our disappointment began. The bed was comfortable and I was pleased to have feather pillows. However, the room was small and dark, and what with the furniture including a desk, side tables and TV table, there wasn't much room to walk around in. Some of the furtniture pieces were really quite scruffy and needed replacing. The bathroom was small, and the bath really low, but the power shower was great. It had been refurbed with a modern WC, sink & taps but the grouting on some of the wall tiles was atrocious and really needed re-doing as it looked a botch job and grubby. The hotel had a business centre which was 2 PCs offering free internet access. But the internet connection was SO slow and had weird parental control settings on them so that I couldn't read up about gambling in Vegas - ?!! There was also a printer in the room. I was on holiday with my brother, and whilst I was in the business centre, my brother was in our room watching TV and suddenly heard a hissing sound. It turns out that the heater / cooler system was leaking and we had to have it switched off as the carpet was wet. It didn't affect our stay as the temperature outside was fine so didn't need the heater/ cooler on. What was slightly concerning, was when my brother pointed out a sticker on the inside of our bedroom door which gave a health warning along the lines of 'these premises may contain traces of carcinogenics in the fabric of the hotel structure' and that they were obliged by the law of the state of california to declare this. Nice! What was a nice touch though was free wine (red or white - no rose!) for residents between 5.30pm and 6.30pm downstairs in the reception / seating area which gave an opportunity to relax abit in the early evening and chat to fellow residents. We didn't eat at the as we were on room only basis. We missed the complimentary coffee in the morning which was served up until 10am. There was a modern separate bar in the hotel which looked trendy but we didn't have a drink in there as we went out for the evening. To summarise, I can see what the hotel is trying to be - the staff are friendly and the reception area is lovely and gives a good first impression, but the hotel really does let itself down with the decor in the room and it really isn't to the standard of a boutique hotel. I know that San Francisco real estate isn't cheap and the location of the hotel is superb, but I expected far more for the price we paid (approx Â£200) and on that basis, I wouldn't recommend the hotel. A few days earlier, (we went to Vegas in-between) we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf, and although the location isn't as central, it's a lot better value, has much bigger and better rooms and has breakfast was included in the price and I would prefer to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “She's been ridden pretty hard”
Reviews.Author: fidelrobert
Reviews.Content: Don't understand what others are saying when they say the rooms are spacious. I stayed in two of them, begged for a larger room, and was told they don't exist. These are very small rooms. The best benefits to this hotel are that it is indeed very well located and the company that owns it is a great group. But, here is what I kept thinking during my recent stay: The old mare has been ridden hard and put to bed wet. Joie de Vivre has put a $1,000 saddle on a $5 horse. Some paint (celedon), some fun art (mostly drawings and sketches) and cleaned her up a bit. But the trim is beat to hell, floor covering isn't secure in places, window air conditioners, dark rooms. If you like Joie de Vivre hotels as I do, let's encourage them to rehab the Galleria Park Hotel. She deserves it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRO5220
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel online months before visiting & were able to book at an outstanding rate. The service was excellent, from the friendly desk folks, to the bellman that gave us ideas on a fun walking tour through China Town & North Beach. The wine tasting was lots of fun & created an enjoyable buzz in the lobby amongst the guests. It is an older building so the rooms are small & being in the city there is noise. But neither of these facts diminished our stay. The next time we visit San Francisco we will visit here again or one of the chains other boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lakeshorebb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and spent the days exploring San Francisco. The location is ideal being very central to both the shopping district and the different cultural areas. It is still close enough to Fisherman's Wharf to walk to, which we did on a couple of occasions. The king size beds and the room amenities were very good and the hotel was clean throughout.. We enjoyed the complimentary wine hour in the evening a couple of times and the coffee on the mezzanine in the morning was a great way to start the day. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very cool down town hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHlondon
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. We got a bargain on a junior suite throught the hotel website. There were some great offers on there, far cheaper than through webagents. The hotel lobby is very cool, with huge fire and atrium ceiling. Our room was great, a bit noisy (from the outside sirens etc) even though we were on the eighth floor, but I expect that in a downtown hotel. The room was not huge, but very spacious and well equipped. There is free wi-fi in the hotel which is a very valuable asset. The food in the brasserie (and therefore the room service) is excellent and the staff there very friendly and knowledgable. This is a great base to explore San Fran and if you can get a bargain it is excellent value for money. The only criticism was that when we arrived (at about 8pm) rather frazzled from travel there was no bell boy to help with the bags and no assistance was offered. However we saw a bell boy the following morning so it mjust just have been the time of day. The concierge was also very good and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location To See City!”
Reviews.Author: Stadiaguy
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to see all the sights of the city. My husband and I traveled to San Francisco at the end of our honeymoon. This location was perfect. We walked everywhere... To AT&T Stadium, to Haight & Ashbury and even to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Gave us great tips of where to go and where to stay away. Affordable hotel that was clean and chic!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a super location...”
Reviews.Author: JoePDX
Reviews.Content: We found the Galleria Park to meet all of our needs for an extended weekend in San Francisco. The location couldn't be beat. We took BART from the airport and from the Montgomery stop the hotel was just a few blocks away. The front desk staff were extremely helpful in offering directions and suggestions. I joined the hotels "Joy of Life" club before we arrived and a bottle of complimentary wine was our welcome. I was able to get a great rate on a Jr. Suite which provided a great amount of room. Furnishings were very nice and the desk chair was incredibly comfortable! It was nice to have a wet bar in the room too. Bathroom was compact, but very clean. Nice toiletries - but limited shelf/storage space in the bathroom. Free high speed internet in the room, plus there was a business center with access to free computers and printers for printing boarding passes. Nice touch! We walked and took the Muni/SF Railway everywhere. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Galleria Park again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: akm723
Reviews.Content: The Galleria Park Hotel was great - we finished our honeymoon there, and had a ton of wine from our earlier days in Sonoma, and they helped us ship it off from the liquor store next door. It was a huge weight off our shoulders. The rooms were nice as well - I enjoyed what we got for fairly low prices. My only grip is the location, which is pretty touristy/financial district. But that's my own fault for not researching the area thoroughly enough! It's right near the BART, which is a major plus.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION,LOCATION,LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: kateCA
Reviews.Content: Two SF natives in town for a reunion. We couldn't have been happier! Priced well and the staff very well-trained and friendly. We have stayed in more expensive Union Square locations which were far noisier. Go around the corner to Cafe La Presse for a great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Be careful which room you are given.”
Reviews.Author: taygirl44
Reviews.Content: We had booked two king rooms but when we checked in and were comparing the rooms with our friends it turned out that they had been given a basic room and we had been given the correct king room. My friend took this up with the front desk who were initially not helpful telling him that there were no kings available but once he perisited he was given the correct room. After this the staff that he had dealt with at the front desk were not friendly towards any of our party. On other occasions we found that the front desk staff were not at all knowledgable on the local area and public transport, or perhaps couldn't be bothered. As said in a previous review their answer to how to get around was to ake a cab. It turns out the public transport system is really good and efficient but you have to find this out for yourself. The location is good as it is central but there are very little facilities opened in the area at night as it is in the financial district nad therefore geared towards the office workers during the day.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked the Galleria Park”
Reviews.Author: orr-fan4
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into this hotel on the recommendation of a friend of hers that lives in SF. I read some good reviews on TripAdvisor so was good with staying here. We got in on a Friday afternoon and were impressed with the Lobby area of the hotel. The front desk staff were quick to check us in and really friendly. We stayed 3 nights and checked out Monday morning to carry on to our next stop which was Napa. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. I can't really understand some of the negative comments because our expereince was great. We would definitely recommend the architectural walking tour that leaves from the hotel lobby every day at 11 am. My husband was more into this than I was, but as the tour started I found that I was really enjoying it too. It was one of the most interesting things that we did while we were there. The tour lasts about 1hr 45 mins and you never get more than about 3 blocks from the hotel but the information and buildings are really interesting and you wouldn't get to see that stuff on your own. The tour normally costs $20.00 per person I think, but guests of the hotel get to do it at no charge. Yes, the rooms are smallish, but the building is OLD, what do you expect? The furniture is comfortable and there was plenty of room for my husand and I. We would recommend this hotel and stay there again wothout hesitation. It was nice to be in the Union Square area as opposed o the Fisherman's Wharf area (where we stayed last time) just for the fact that it was less busy in this area. The shopping is amazing at Union Square and Chinatown is only a few blocks away. We would also recommend getting a MUNI pass which covers all buses and cablecars. It is easy to hop a cablecar or bus or trolley and get from area to area.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: lrgardner
Reviews.Content: stayed at the galleria park hotel for 10 days in september with my wife to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary.booked hotel after reading reports on trip advisor and people are spot on.this is a great hotel.centrally located for exploring san francisco.close to the bart(underground) cable car ,sreet car and muni transport system plus within walking distance to all major shops like macys etc.the room we had had a king size bed with well stocked fridge with bath and showe plus tv ,iron and also bath robes.rooms were cleaned every day the hotel offers comp coffee am and wine pm but staff were ALL friendly and could not do enough for you.i had trouble with my mobile phone and bought a phone card which would not work from the hotel so the receptionist gave me her own mobile so i could ring the uk. plenty of restaurants nearby plus the normal bagel shops and starbucks.so i have to give this hotel a 5 star rating all round and the price is good compared with other hotels i checked which was alot.make sure you visit the round the world restaurants in the shopping centre under ground near bloomingdales which covers all tastes.visit alcartraz in the evening when you get a audio tour plus the open top bus tour gives you a insight of where to visit.the only downside is beggars asking you for money but they do not hazzle you. i recommend san francisco and the galleria park hotel which was a warm and welcoming clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice City Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MasieMasie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and it were pleased. Our room (deluxe King) was fairly standard. Not huge but ok for a city centre hotel. Clean and nice decor. We'd read some reviews and decided that we'd prefer a quiet rather than light room so we requested a courtyard rather than street view. They put us on the top floor and that suited us well. All the staff we met were helpful. They booked football tickets for us. Location is great. 5 mins from Union Square and all the public tranport. Would recommend buying a Muni pass as this covers all the buses Muni trains, cable cars and streetcars. We used the buses loads. Get a transport map and see the city for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Stay”
Reviews.Author: WigK
Reviews.Content: Loved it, loved it! I decided to treat myself for my birthday last week and booked a King room on Expedia. I had researched the Joie de Vivre chain & liked what I saw. Hotel Tomo, Americania & Good Hotel were booked, so Park Galleria was the choice. In the past I've stayed in a youth hostel & the Hotel Max, which were both located in the Tenderloin. This time I wanted to stay in a different location. I don't get the negative complaints about this hotel. How much room do you really need for a business trip or basic vacation? Boutique hotels are generally smaller & honestly I felt that the size of the King room had enough space to my liking & looked like the photos on the site. The decor still has a Victorian style to it, but colorful & plush. My room was on the 3rd floor - 321 - facing Sutter Street. I love outside noise so hearing taxi cabs, buses and people on their way to work was not an issue. I slept like a baby after sightseeing half the day. Third floor was quiet & I barely heard a peep from the cleaning crew or other travelers. The hotel staff was pleasant & helpful with providing info on which Muni buses & trains to take. The location is central and the Montogomery BART is right around the corner. Internet connection worked fine for me. The wireless connection was "Stay Online" so those that say the connection was slow may have selected the wrong one. Considering what this hotel looked like in the past, JDV did an excellent job updating the decor. The restaurant Midi had my mouth watering for more. I devoured my flank steak & garlic fries. The good thing is that if you don't want to spend money on expensive alcohol at the hotel, you can walk 30 seconds up the street to the mini liquor store. BUT, they do offer the free wine tasting from 5:30 -6:30. Unfortunately I was always on my way out when the tasting started. Galleria is definitely an affordable boutique hotel, so it probably better serves couples & solo travelers. For those expecting more "posh" or family-friendly hotels, book at SF hotels were you spend $250+ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom is an indication if the room is clean or not”
Reviews.Author: guchiquita
Reviews.Content: The bathtub needs culking. Bathroom smells dirty (pee). Towels smells paint. I am glad i arrived late at night and left very early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, tremendous staff, and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: jecatudel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Galleria Park for a week this past August, touring the city with my g/f, and the hotel was perfect for us. I should say, though, that we upgraded to a park suite, one of the best rooms at the hotel, and we probably wouldn't have had enough room if we had simply stayed with a king room as originally planned. The hotel had a great staff, all of whom were extremely friendly and were very willing to answer any of our questions and provide local advice on San Francisco. The rooms were well-kept and the cleaning staff always did a nice job of cleaning our rooms each day. The biggest reason I would recommend the hotel, though, is because of its location. The hotel is within walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, the Embarcadero Center, Little Italy, and the street and cable cars. There are several really good restaurants, bars, nightlife within a four-five block radius of the hotel; plus, it is also located in a safe area. The only downside, though, was the hotel wasn't as posh or nice as I expected, especially since we paid a lot for the suite. However, I must admit I have been spoiled by Las Vegas; for those who have been there, hotels in Vegas are cheap, yet extremely nice. Of course, the hotel is part of the attraction in Vegas, whereas the city is the attraction in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and value,great hotel”
Reviews.Author: screamer23
Reviews.Content: We had booked for three days and ended up booking this hotel for three further nights we enjoyed the stay so much.Fantastic location 2 blocks from Union Square and one from China town.The staff were so friendly and professional and it was great value at 119 a night.Lovely room, nice toiletries in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: travel1ontario
Reviews.Content: After a very LONG trip we were very excited to arrive to our hotel. Upon entering the lobby we were very impressed by its decor, even though they slammed the door on us as we were carrying our luggage. When we checked in I was very surprised to find we had a room for 1 that had a single bed, when we booked 2 beds. They were rude, and not helpful in providing another room which we specified on before arriving. Since, it was a long trip we asked for dining suggestion and the lady, was not forthcoming so we wondered around and found a lovely place to eat in Chinatown. While, the room was small, and they wouldn't provide another room with 2 beds unless we paid over $100.00 for our stay it is an excellent location. Since, we were out sightseeing, the peeling paint, holes in the walls and the noise from the adjoining room didn't bother us too much. One tip, that I was shocked about was the airport shuttle. The night before our departure I inquired at the desk about a shuttle service to the airport. The hotel said they didn't offer such a service nor were they willing to help us locate one, and get a cab and pay the $50,00 to the airport. We found American shuttle which offered $14 per person. In the morning Eric was very helpful and asked if the hotel arranged our service I was appalled when I learned they in fact did have a service. I learned near the end of the trip, the ladies who work the desk are usually rude, indifferent and their answer to everything is get a cab whether you are going to the golden gate bride, or the wharf. The men on staff, especially Eric are helpful and nice. There was also another gentlemen, I have forgotten his name who was excellent and apologized as well for the shuttle fiasco. He carried our bags to the cab and was the only person who wished us a nice day with a smile. Although the location is great I was horrified by their lack of interest in their guests and will not be staying here again. I am not sure what happened to making a guest feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “worst stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: sandy1177
Reviews.Content: Very noisy. I could sleep at a metro station and it woud be quieter.staff is totally rude and noncourteous.I would never recommend this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hestitate to come back”
Reviews.Author: Gingersmom
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 3 nights. We each had our own room which was good as the rooms we were in were a bit small but that is very typical of SF. I was in an inside room and found it quite warm, she was in an outside room and found it nice & cool. Loved the decor and the location. We walked to Chinatown fairly late in the evening and felt no concern until the businesses starting closing-time to get back to the hotel. The bed and linens were excellent, very comfortable, clean and inviting. The bathroom was very nice, small but sufficient. I had a tub which was a little odd in that it sloped down which made standing in the shower a bit tricky. My sister had a walk-in shower which I would have loved. Not sure why hotels still do baths, I like a bath but find the idea of a bath in a location other than home a bit off-putting. Staff was friendly and helpful enough. Only snafu was that I had called a month earlier about King Tut tickets and they said they had lots. Checked the night we arrived and said they had lots. Checked the next day and none . We were planning to go Monday a.m. and I was quite disappointed. They called us on cell mid day and said they'd found 2 tix but by then it was too late, we were almost on the way to the airport. I called head office on return and they investigated, turns out there were tickets but likely they were locked in the safe and nobody knew which made it even worse. I missed the exhibit in London about 37 years ago as I was too ill to go and have been wanting to go since. But sort of my fault for not ordering beforehand to ensure we had them. The hotel was quite apologetic but no offer of a discount on our rooms or anything else which I found a bit odd. I would have liked a continental breakfast, saves trudging the streets looking for a place to eat. Other than that, no complaints. Nice walk to Ferry Building to catch the ferry to Sausalito, close to Union Square shopping. A tip - Cable Car lineups can be daunting, we caught the trolley for $2, worked like a charm.
